loans.name: Lewelyn

texts.en:
Lewelyn previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy fertilizers, seeds and other tools for the maintenance of her farm. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. She works hard to continually expand her business and to establish more business in the future. 

Lewelyn would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy farming materials and supplies. Her profits from her business will definitely help her sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lewelyn wants to expand her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farming materials and supplies

loans.name: Vicent Cyril

texts.en:
Vicent Cyril, aged 40, is a widower from Digson, Bonifacio  who has three children. He is an entrepreneur and earns income from his transport service business. Vicent Cyril started  his business almost two years ago and he earns 10,000 PHP a month. 

To improve his business, he is borrowing 25,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit which he joined recently. He will use the loan to buy motorcycle accessories and tires. Vicent Cyril is hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business before long.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle accessories and tires.

loans.name: Sawa Ya Kola Group

texts.en:
Hope, aged 29, is a married woman  who has three children and a dependant who is an orphan. She is very hard-working and social. She sells foodstuffs like Irish potatoes and plantains which are delicacies for most people especially for the middle class in the city. 

Hope operates her business in a busy market making high daily sales. With the profits, she is educating her children as well as the orphan in her care. In future, with increased income, Hope will begin another business to supplement the existing one. Her major challenges are stiff competition, limited capital and unfaithful debtors. Hope is the one kneeling on the left.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.ru: Одилджон проживает в районе Кумсангир. Он женат. Ему 35 лет. Одилджон живет с женой. Его жена занимается домашним хозяйством, а также она на грядке выращивает овощи. Одилджон добропорядочный человек. Он хочет заняться своим делом, зарабатывать и обеспечивать семью. Одилджон берет кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота (именно бычков). Таким образом, он намерен начать свое дело. Одилджон будет разводить скот у себя дома.
texts.en: Odiljon lives in the Qumsangir region.  He is married, 35 years old and he lives with his wife, who works as a homemaker and also raises vegetables in the garden.  Odiljon is a respectable person; he wants to go about his business to work and support of his family.  He is asking for a loan to buy large livestock (specifically bulls), as he intends to start a business raising livestock at his home.

loans.use: to buy bulls.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy garbage cans for a garbage can-selling business

loans.name: Alijon

texts.ru: Алижон проживает в районе Кумсангир. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Алижон занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. Этим видом деятельности он занимается восемь лет. Алижон берет кредит для посева озимой пшеницы.
texts.en: Alijon lives in the Qumsangir region.  He is 28 years old and is married with one child.  Alijon is an agricultural worker and he has been in this line of work for eight years.  He is asking for a loan so he can plant his winter wheat.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru: Назокат жительница района Пяндж. Ей 28 лет. Назокат замужем. У нее один ребенок. Ее муж находится на заработках за рубежом. Назокат портниха, она шьет национальные платья. Этим видом деятельности Назокат занимается два года. Она берет кредит для приобретения модернизированной швейной машинки.
texts.en: Nazokat lives in the Pyandj region.  She is 28 years old and is married with one child.  Her husband is a migrant worker abroad.  Nazokat is a seamstress; she sews national dresses.  She has been in this line of work for two years.  She is asking for a loan to buy a modern sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a modern sewing machine

loans.name: Jamilamo

texts.ru: Чамиламо живет в городе Куляб. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж Чамиламо госслужащий. Ее дети учатся в школе. Образование у Чамиламо высшее, она учитель. По специальности Чамиламо работает пятнадцать лет. По вечерам она занимается шитьем. В этой области Чамиламо имеет богатый опыт. Она более семнадцати лет занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Чамиламо берет кредит для покупки швейной машинки.
texts.en: Jamilamo lives in the city of Kulob.  She is 39 years old and is married with five children.  Her husband is a civil servant and her children are in school.  Jamilamo has a higher education; she is a teacher, a specialty in which she has been working for 15 years.  She sews in the evenings and she has a lot of experience in this area.  She has been sewing national dresses for more than 17 years.  Jamilamo is asking for a loan to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Abdulmumin

texts.ru: Абдулмумин живет в городе Куляб. Ему 26 лет. Он холост. Абдулмумин арендует помещение, где занимается очисткой хлопка. Этим видом деятельности он занимается год. Абдулмумин берет кредит для приобретения оборудования для выжимания масла. Он хочет продолжить свою деятельность, а также заняться производством хлопкового масла.
texts.en: Abdulmumin lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 26 years old and single.  He rents a space where he works in cotton ginning.  He has been in this line of work for a year.  Abdulmunin is asking for a loan to buy an oil pressing machine.  He wants to continue in his business and also to produce cottonseed oil.

loans.use: to buy equipment for pressing oil

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy two sacks of beans, potatoes, oil, Fanta, Primus, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ziyoda

texts.ru: Зиёда трудолюбивая и добрая женщина. Ей 37 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Мать Зиёды живет вместе с ними. Так как у нее очень большая семья и содержать такую большую семью тяжело, Зиёда решила найти новый источник дохода. Она уже несколько лет работает в школе учительницей и ее зарплата не хватает для содержания семьи. Ее муж занимается скотоводством и имеет большой опыт. Поэтому Зиёда решила организовать свой бизнес скотоводством, так как ее муж обещал ей помочь в ведении бизнеса. С целью организовать свой бизнес, она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она будет покупать скот, присматривать несколько месяцев и перепродавать по более высокой цене, чем она его приобрела. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  1500 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ziyoda is a hard-working and kind woman.  She is 37 years old and is married with four children at home.  Ziyoda's mother lives with them.  Since she has a very large family and supporting such a large family is difficult, Ziyoda decided to find her own source of income.  For a few years she has worked as a schoolteacher and her salary is not enough to support her family.  Her husband works in raising livestock and he has a great deal of experience in this field.  For this reason, Ziyoda has decided to start her own business raising animals, as her husband has promised to help her run her business.  With the goal of starting her business, she enrolled in the "Get Ahead" course offered by the Association of Businesswomen and earned a certificate.  Now she is fully capable of starting her own business and becoming successful in that sphere.  She will buy a herd of livestock, look after it for a few months and sell them on at a higher price than she originally paid.  She is asking for a loan of 1,500 somoni to buy the livestock to start her new business.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start her new business

loans.name: Orzujon

texts.ru:
Орзучон житель города Куляб. Он 27 - летний женатый молодой человек. У него четверо детей. Он живет с родителями. Жена Орзучона домохозяйка. 
Орзучон работает парикмахером. Он более десяти лет в этой области. Три года назад Орзучон открыл собственный мужской салон. На сегодняшний день Орзучон берет кредит для ремонта парикмахерской и приобретения необходимой мебели. Также он хочет отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en: Orzujon lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 27 years old and is married with four children.  He lives with his parents and his wife is a homemaker.  Orzujon works as a hairdresser.  He has been in this line of work for more than 10 years.  Three years ago, Orzujon opened his own barber shop.  Today, he is asking for a loan to renovate his shop and to buy the furniture he needs.  He also wants to make repairs on his home.

loans.use: to renovate his salon, buy new furniture and make repairs on his home

loans.name: Saidakhtam

texts.ru: Саидахтам житель города Куляб. Ему 54 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Саидахтам предоставляет услугу. Он развозит пассажиров по городу. Этим видом деятельности он занимается более двух лет. Саидахтам берет кредит для ремонта автомашины марки Такгем.
texts.en: Saidakhtam is a resident of Kulob.  He is 54 years old and married with four children.  Saidakhtam offers a service of carrying passengers around his city.  He has been in this business for over two years.  Saidakhtam is taking out this loan to repair his vehicle, the make which is a "Tangem."

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Revendeuse de basins, de mèches et de chaussures de façon ambulante, madame Akou est une jeune dame de 26ans très dynamique. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, elle fait du commerce et sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter de la marchandise afin de vendre aux clients pour tirer profit.  Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle veut ouvrir une boutique, se marier et avoir des enfants qu’elle pourra élever favorablement avec les bénéfices réalisés.
texts.en: Akou is a re-seller of bowls, hair extensions and shoes who makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor.  She is a very dynamic young lady of 26.  In order to cover her needs, she buys and sells products.  She is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy merchandise to re-sell to her customers so that she can make profits.  Her future goals are to open a store, to get married and to have children who she can raise well with the profits she makes from her business.

loans.use: to buy bowls, hair extensions and shoes

loans.name: Coeur Angelique De Ouanaminthe Group

texts.fr:
Elardain est le coordinateur de son groupe coeur angeliques. Il est marié il a 3 enfants. Elardain habite dans la ville de ouanaminthe d’Haiti. Elardain a dirigé son business pendant les 7 dernières années.

Elardain voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat des charbon. Elardain espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business.

Des autres membres de coeur angeliques ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du tennis, du riz, le produits divers, cosmetologie et du poisson.

Elardain dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant. Il dit que ses buts principaux sont l’augmentation du bussines. et est l’achat d’un camion pour transporter les charbon.
texts.en:
Elardain is the coordinator of the 'Coeur Angelique' group.  He is married and has three children.  Elardain lives in the town of Ounaminthe, in Haiti.  He has been running his business for the last seven years.

Elardain would like to use this loan to invest in buying charcoal.  He hopes that the loan will help him to grow his business.

The other members of the 'Coeur Angelique' group need a loan for their businesses which include: selling sports shoes, selling rice, selling miscellaneous goods, providing beauty treatments and selling fish.

Elardain says that his main challenge is a lack of steady customers.  His main goals are to expand his business and buy a truck for transporting charcoal.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Kenbe Fem Group

texts.fr:
Jeantilia est le coordinatrice de son groupe Kenbe Fem. Elle n’est pas marié mais elle a 2 enfants. Elle habite dans la ville de paulette d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Jeantilia a dirigé son business pendant les 6 dernières années.

Jeantilia voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat du produit Divers,que des chaussures, sacs à main, accessoires. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Des autres membres de les kenbe fem ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et du poisson. Jeantilia dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant .
texts.en:
Jeantilia is the coordinator of the 'Kenbe Fem' group.  She is not married but has two children.  She lives in the town of Paulette, in Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is scarce.  Jeantila has been running her business for the last six years.

Jeantilia would like to use this loan to invest in buying a range of products including shoes, bags and accessories.  She hopes that this loan will help her to grow her business.  The other members of the Kenbe Fem group need a loan for their businesses which include: selling charcoal, rice and fish.  Jeantilia says that her main challenge is a lack of steady customers.

loans.use: to buy a range of products to sell

loans.name: Etoile Du Matin Group

texts.fr:
Ritha est la coordinatrice de son groupe Etoile Du Matin. Elle habite dans la région de SIBERIE d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Ritha a dirigé son commerce de produits alimentairess pendant les 10 dernières années. Ritha voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir de produits divers (pour acheter des vêtements, cosmétiques, chaussures, accessoires pour les femmes, etc.)

Des autres membres Du groupe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre des produits alimentaires et du charbon. Ritha dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteurs constants a cause du chômage. Ritha dit que son rêve est la construction d’une belle maison
texts.en:
Ritha is the coordinator of the 'Etoile du Matin' group.  She lives in the Siberie region of Haiti where electricity is rare and water is scarce.

Ritha has been running her business for the past 10 years.  She would like to use this loan to invest in buying a range of products (clothing, cosmetics, shoes, ladies' accessories, etc).

The other members of this group need a loan for their businesses which include selling food and charcoal.  Ritha says that her dream is to build a nice house.

loans.use: to buy clothing, cosmetics, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Зухро 30 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Зухро великолепная женщина с устойчивым характером и щедрой душой. Ее великодушие всегда помогает ей реализовать планы с хорошими результатами. Ее муж занимается скотоводством.  Зухро тоже решила, как муж заниматься скотоводством и быть успешной, чем он. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Ее полученные знания и навыки помогут ей в ведении бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zuhro is 30 years old.  She is married and she has three children at home.  She is a wonderful woman of solid character with a generous soul.  Her generosity always helps her fulfill her plans with good results.  Her husband is involved in raising livestock and Zuhro has also decided, like her husband, to begin raising livestock and to become more successful than him.  With that goal in mind, she enrolled in the "Get Ahead" course offered by the Association of Businesswomen and received a certificate.  Her knowledge and skills will help her in this business.  With the income she receives, she plans to provide her children with a good education and high-calorie food products.  She is asking for a loan of 1,000 somoni to buy livestock to start her new business.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start her new business

loans.name: Les Phares De Ouanaminthe Group

texts.fr:
Saintamise est la coordonatrice de son groupe LES PHARES DE OUANAMINTHE. Elle est marie et a 2 enfants. Elle habite dans la ville de OUANAMINTHE d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Saintamise a dirigé son business pendant les 4 dernières années. Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat du tennis et chaussures. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Les autres membres Les Phares ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz, chaussures et des vetements.

Saintamise dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant. Son rêve est l’achat d’un camion pour transporter les marchandises. Elle dit que ses buts principaux sont l’augmantation du bussiness.
texts.en:
Saintamise is the coordinator of the 'Les Phares de Ouanaminthe' group.  She is married, has two children, and lives in the town of Ouanaminthe, in Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very scarce.

Saintamise has been running her business for the last four years.  She would like to use this loan to invest in buying sneakers and shoes.  She hopes that this loan will help her to grow her business.  The other members of this group need a loan for their businesses which include selling charcoal, rice, shoes and clothing.

Saintamise says that her biggest challenge is lacking steady customers.  Her dream is to buy a truck for transporting her merchandise.  Her main goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sneakers and shoes

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est composé de femmes mariées et de veuves, qui ont en moyenne 45 ans, 5 enfants et qui vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de moquettes, de friperies et des articles de décoration  de salon.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                  
La cliente ROKIA, première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter une dizaine de moquette et des articles de décoration de salon qui seront vendus à crédit aux fonctionnaires de différentes structures professionnelles de la place.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of married women and widows who have an average age of 45 and, on average, 5 children.  They all live in large, traditional families in the town of Fana, in Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These ladies know each other as family, neighbors and friends.  They sell rugs, second-hand clothing and home furnishings.  They are on their third group loan.

Rokia, the lady sitting on the left of the photo, plans to buy ten rugs and some home furnishings which she will re-sell on credit to local government workers.

Rokia hopes to make an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs.  She will use some to cover her family's needs and will re-invest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to buy rugs and home furnishings

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djèkafo est composé de femmes mariées et de veuves, elles ont en moyenne 45 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, quartier Fana-Coura, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce, de colliers, de bijoux, d’habillements, de riz et de savon.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Djèkafo sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                               
La cliente SIRA, personne au milieu dans le rang des debout, compte acheter 5 kg de perles de différentes catégories avec les revendeurs de Bamako. Avec ces perles elle fabrique des colliers (destinés au cou, à la ceinture etc) qui seront vendues sur place, aux clients de Nangola, Banco, de N’Golobougou, au comptant et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Djèkafo group is made up of married women and widows who have an average age of 45 and, on average, 4 children.  They all live in extended, traditional families in Fana-Coura neighborhood, in the town of Fana, in Koulikoro region (second administrative region of Mali).

These ladies know each other as family, neighbors and friends.  They sell necklaces, jewelry, clothing, rice and soap.  This is their tenth group loan.

Sira, the lady standing in the middle of the photo, plans to buy 5kg of different grades of beads from re-sellers in Bamako.  She will use these beads to make necklaces, belts, etc. which she will then sell from her sales location to customers from Nangola, Banco and N'Golobougou.  She sells for cash and often also on credit.

Sira hopes to make an average monthly profit of 75,000 francs.  She will use some of the money to meet her family's needs and will re-invest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to buy beads

loans.name: Danilo

texts.es:
Danilo de 28 años de edad, originario de Estelí,  es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de venta de leche, desde hace 7 años, con  conocimiento académico de sexto grado de primaria, padre de 2 hijos los cuales están a su cargo. Inicio trabajando con su padre desde muy joven en la venta de leche,  el cual obtuvo mucha experiencia y dominio en el  negocio, luego se independizo y decidió seguir con el mismo negocio, este ha sido su primer negocio, el cuenta con el apoyo de su padre y sus hermanos, tiene otros ingresos como es la venta de cerdo que realiza por temporada, sus expectativas es seguir manteniendo activo su negocio para incrementar sus ventas y asi  obtener mejores ingresos.
Danilo solicita el préstamo para comprar bidones(envases grandes de almacenanmiento de leche) para entregar la leche y pagar mano de obra de sus trabajadores. El estima que este préstamo le ayudaría mucho porque de esta manera aumentaría sus ventas de leche y le ayudaría a crecer como comerciante. Sus planes futuros es establecer otro negocio como es la venta de queso, su meta próxima es invertir mas en su negocio de venta de leche.
texts.en:
Danielo is 28 years old and from the city of Esteli.  He is a merchant by trade and has been selling milk for the past seven years.  He has a sixth grade education and is the father of two children whom he cares for.  He began working with his father, selling milk when he was very young.  He gained much experience and learned the business well.  Later he went out on his own and decided to continue in the same business.  This is his first business and he has the support of his father and siblings.  He has other income from the sale of pigs each season.  His expectations are to continue active in his business to increase his sales and better his income.

Danielo is asking for this loan to buy drums (large containers for storing milk), to deliver milk, and pay his workers.  He believes that this loan will help him greatly because he will be able to increase his milk sales and grow as a merchant.  His future plans are to set up another business selling cheese.  His next goal is to invest more into his milk business.

loans.use: to buy milk drums.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
This is Rosana, She previously accessed an 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a vulcanizing shop for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Rosana hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of their work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a shell crafting business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13000 PHP through NWTF to purchase materials for her shell crafting business.

NWTF is relisting Angelita's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her shell crafting business.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para el fortalecimiento del negocio en las fechas de Navidad y Año Nuevo, pues considera que la demanda aumenta, ella comprará maíz para realizar la venta y también comprará pan para vender en esta temporada, esto le ayudará a crear una fuente de ingresos temporal que les deje un margen de ganancia.

El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue mantener a los clientes satisfechos, ya que fortaleció el negocio con lo cual se ha mantenido trabajando, ha realizado sus pagos de las obligaciones del hogar también ha comprado algunos electrodomésticos para la casa.
texts.en:
Maria is asking for a new loan to strengthen her business over the Christmas and New Year season.  This is when her customer demands are highest.  She will buy corn to sell and will also buy bread to sell during the season.  This will help her grow and create a source of temporary income that will leave her with a profit.

The previous loan allowed her to keep her customers happy because she was able to strengthen the business and allowed her to keep working.  She was also able to meet her household obligations and buy some appliances for her home.

loans.use: to buy corn and bread.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia, She previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a canteen for additional income and she is continually working hard to provide for her everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a higher profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Virginia simply hopes to have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sofronio

texts.en: Sofronio is from Happy Valley, Tambulig. He is 34 years old and married. Sofronio raises pigs for sale. Sofronio been in his business for 3 years and earns 20,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2011, Sofronio joined GDMPC. Sofronio is requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to renovate his house.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is a 31-year-old married woman and mother of two young children from Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in hog raising business for more than 3 years now. Arlene is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs. In the future, she hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Gantsetseg

texts.en: Gantsetseg is 30 years old lives with her husband and daughter in a ger in Hentii Province, Mongolia. Her husband Uuganbold, 33, works at a local company. Her daughter Tsogtsetseg, 2, has just started going to the local kindergarten. The borrower graduated from a hairdressing course in 2011 and has worked at hair salon until now. She is now planning to open her own hair dressing business and is requesting 4,000,000 MNT to purchase hairdressing chairs, mirrors and other equipment for this new venture. She is a hardworking, modest and honest woman.

loans.use: to purchase hair dressing chairs, mirrors and other equipment for her new hairdressing business.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora, de 66 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación, además de ser amable y cordial.  Esta casad con Uderico, tiene 03 hijos de 25, 23 y 18 quienes ya son independientes, quienes la apoyan y  quieren mucho.  Vive en compañía de esposo, viviendo cómodamente su propia casa.
La actividad que realiza Dora es la venta de bebidas gasificadas para eso cuenta con un refrigeradora y un pequeño local  en el interior su casa propia, además de acondicionar el ambiente con música selecta y agradable al gusto de sus clientes, donde atiende a sus clientes de una manera amable y cordial 
Considera a  su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene éste  producto por lo caluroso de la zona y las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Tiene más de 05 años en éste negocio que realiza  con el apoyo de sus hijos cuando  la visitan y están en casa.
 Le gustan su oficio ya que le permiten estar ocupada  y tener un ingreso económico con el cual poder solventar sus gastos personales; escogió éste oficio ya que se lo traspaso uno de sus hijos quien se retiro por viaje a otra ciudad, esta actividad le da tranquilidad emocional y financiera. 
Viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo, tiene planes de mejorar e implementar su negocio. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 11 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta por contar con una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio. Además comenta sentirse a gusto con su grupo solidario ya que conoce a sus miembros y los considera ser personas amables y responsables.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en compra de bebidas gasificadas de diversas marcas y presentaciones, por cajas a precio por mayor; y también un amplificador de sonido valorizado en 300 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Dora is 66 years old and is a hardworking woman with a great desire to get ahead.  She is also cordial and friendly.  She is married to Uderico and has three children, ages 25, 23, and 18, who are all on they own and support and love her very much.  She lives with comfortably in her home with her husband.

Dora sells carbonated drinks and has a small refrigerator and a small area in her home.  She also plays music to her customers’ taste for atmosphere, and serves them in a friendly and polite way.

She considers her business to be very profitable because of the demand due of the hot temperatures in the zone and the profits is leaves her. 

She has been doing this for more than five years and her children help her whenever they visit.

She likes this business because it allows her to stay busy and have an income with which she can pay her personal expenses.  She chose it because one of her children retired and passed it to her when he moved to another city.  The business is calm, exciting, and profitable. 

Having seen the good results she is having, she has plans to improve her business.  Therefor this will be her 11th loan through MFP.  She is happy to be able to count on this line of credit to advance her business.  She also says that she is comfortable with her group because the other members are friendly and responsible.

She will use the 1,000 PEN from this loan to buy cases of carbonated drinks of different brands and types.  She will also buy a sound system valued at 300 PEN.

loans.use: to buy cases of drinks.

loans.name: Tomasa Del Carmen

texts.es: Tomasa del Carmen, ha aprendido este negocio gracias a su madre, la Sra. Tomasa  se dedica de la venta de mercadería en general como la venta de ropa, chinelas cosméticos prendas, al igual que también se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos en pie a comerciantes de Chinandega ella tiene clientes fijos y eventuales en comarcas cercanas a su hogar negocio que lo realiza en la comarca el piloto, ranchería del municipio de Chinandega, con 15 préstamos ha podido levantar su negocio con muchos esfuerzos ha podido ir incrementando poco a poco su negocio, ella ha podido llegar a sus clientes de una manera humilde para realizar sus ventas, el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para incrementar más su capital de trabajo para invertir en la compra y venta de Cerdos en Pie y  así poder ofrecerles a sus clientes una mejor variedad de cerdos por  lo que está cerca una temporada en la cual ella como comerciante le es favorable.
texts.en: Tomasa del Carmen learned this business thanks to her mother.  She sells general merchandise such as clothing, cosmetics, and also pigs on the hoof to merchants in Chinadega.  She has steady customers and occasional ones in nearby settlements.  She runs her business out of her home, located in the “El Piloto” rural area of the city of Chinandega.  The past 15 loans have helped her lift up her business with great effort and it allowed her to grow it little by little.  The goal for this new loan is to buy and sells hogs on the hoof so that she can provide her customers with a greater selection of pigs, now that the most favorable time of years for businesses is approaching.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Norayr

texts.en:
Norayr lives with his parents and grandmother in Khndzoresk village, located in the Syunik region. Norayr and his parents are involved in cattle breeding and currently have eight cows and six pigs. Norayr's mother makes cheese which his father sells in the local markets.

Because agriculture is the only source of income for the family, Norayr wants to expand their enterprise and so has requested this loan to purchase three more cows. The resulting increased milk production will be used to make more cheese, thereby significantly increasing family income.

The loan is very important for Norayr, as higher profits will ensure better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for three cows.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
This is Eufemia. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan, of 12,000 PHP, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her business profits will definitely help meet her family’s daily needs and the children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial improvement with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Eufemia hopes to expand soon and dreams of giving her children a good quality education. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda, who previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan to buy more coconuts for her business. Her additional earnings were a big help in meeting her personal, household and business expenses. She also earns income as a peanut dealer. Yolanda is requesting a new loan for 30,000 PHP to buy more coconuts for her business. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Yolanda hopes to have a good life, and dreams of expanding her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more coconuts to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Carina

texts.es:
Carina, de 37 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y amable tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está casada con Rolando  quien es empleado y padre de sus 2 hijos de 15 y 5 años de edad deseando brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa que compraron son el fruto de sus ahorros de varios años.
La actividad que realiza  Carina es la venta de comida como desayunos, menús y platos extras de la amazonia. Todos estos alimentos los prepara en su local acondicionado en su propia casa, y los vende a su distinguida clientela qua a diario la visitan, brindándoles un trato amable y cordial. También ese local lo alquila para recepciones y eventos sociales.  Iniciándose hace más de 2 años con un capital y realizando compras pequeñas, pero viendo la buena acogida fueron aumentando poco a poco, ganándose la preferencia de sus clientes y ahora necesita contar con el apoyo de algunos ayudantes a quienes paga por semana.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja y la demanda que tienen sus platillos.
Antes de tener este negocio no tenía problemas, pero se decidió iniciarlo para tener una ocupación, sentirse una persona productiva y una prospera empresaria e independiente. Ahora  viendo los buenos resultados, tiene planes de ampliar su local para aumentar la capacidad de personas. Así brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 05 con la institución MFP. Se siente contenta de saber que contara con un apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Por tanto se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal, por el apoyo a las personas con el acceso a líneas de créditos.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de ingredientes al por mayor para la preparación de sus diversos platillos, buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen, así tendrá mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Carina is 37 years old and is a hardworking, dedicated woman.  She is also happy and friendly with a great desire to get ahead.  She is married to Rolando who works for his father and they have two children, ages 15 and 5, to whom he wants to provide a better quality of life.  Together they live comfortably in the house that they bought with their savings of various years.

Carina sells food, including breakfast, menu items, and Amazonian style dishes.  All of this food is local and prepared in her home.  She sells to her customers each day, giving them friendly and polite service.  She also rents out her place for receptions and social events.  She began two years ago with her own capital, but having seen the success of the business; she grew it little by little and gained more customers.  Now she has employees whom she pays weekly.

She considers her business to be profitable because of the good income and the demand for her dishes.

Before this business she had no problems, but she decided to start it to have an occupation and feel like a productive and successful independent entrepreneur.  Now that she has had good results, she plans to expand her location so that she can serve more people and provide better service to her customers.  Therefore this will be her fifth loan through MFP.  She feels happy knowing that she can advance with her business.  She is also committed to making her payments, as with her previous loans.  She likes the communal bank because of the encouragement from the other members and because of her access to lines of credit.

She will use the 1,000 PEN that she is requesting to buy ingredients in quantity for her various dishes.  She is looking for better prices by buying in bulk so that she can increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Zakarya

texts.en:
Zakarya is a 30-year-old man. He is married and the father of two sons and two daughters. He lives with his family in a small modest house in Jabalia refugee camp. For the past two years, Zakarya has been selling clothes to customers. He has a good reputation among his many loyal customers. This project, considered a profitable one, is the only source of income for Zakarya and his family. The business needs more support to cover some costs.
Zakarya is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of bringing in a new collection of clothes to sell. Taking this loan will permit him to offer his customers a wide variety of clothing to choose from and buy, which will increase sales and improve Zakarya's income.
Zakarya is photographed inside his store.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталья  -  фермер. С 1996 года занимается выращиванием клубники, чеснока и помидор.
Справляться по хозяйству ей помогает  двое детей 16-ти и 32-х лет. 
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания капусты и помидоров.
Наталья с детьми решила приобрести оборудование для скважины и насос, т.к. в данной местности существуют  большие проблемы с водой для полива, особенно в летний период  засухи, полив клубники приходится осуществлять вручную.
В планах на будущие:  посадить кукурузу, а также в планах поставить теплицу для выращивания клубники.
В личных планах: обеспечить  образованием младшего сына .
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования оборудования для скважины.
texts.en:
Nataliya is a farmer.  Since 1996 she has been growing strawberries, garlic, and tomatoes.  Her children, aged 16 and 32, help her with the farm.  She started her business growing cabbage and tomatoes.

Nataliya and her children have decided to buy equipment for a well and pump since their region has a lot of problems with water for irrigation, especially during the summer dry season when they have to water the strawberries by hand.

Among their plans for the future are to plant maize and to build a greenhouse for growing strawberries.  One of Nataliya's personal plans is to provide her youngest son with an education.

She needs your help to finance the well and pump equipment.

loans.use: to purchase irrigation equipment

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and to pay for maintenance on their tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help with their personal, household and business expenditures. She is also engaged in direct sales, to earn additional income. She works hard to provide income for her family.

She would like to apply a new loan, of 15,000 PHP, to buy spare parts and pay for maintenance on their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial improvement with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Erlinda dreams of expanding soon and having more customers. She hopes to have a good life with her family. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance on their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Celo

texts.en: Celo is a fisherman from Bohol, Philippines. He has been in the fishing business for several years. Celo is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and fuel for his boat. With this loan, he will be able to enhance his daily catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Celo hopes to expand his business and save money to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for his fishing boat.

loans.name: Chalita

texts.en: Chalita runs a sari-sari or variety store business in her place and sells various goods and commodities to the people there. Chalita is asking for a loan to buy additional groceries like canned goods, noodles, chips and snack foods, soap and toiletries. With this she will be able to cater and sell more products, thus augmenting her sales and profit. In the future, Chalita hopes of making her business a success.  Moreover, she wants to save money for the reinvestment of the same business and for savings purposes.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries like canned goods, noodles, chips and snack foods, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Blas Mesias

texts.es:
BLAS MESIAS tiene 39 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y el esposo en San José de Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

BLAS MESIAS se dedica a la confección y venta de confiteria esto lo hace en todos los alrededores. Solicita el crédito para comprar azúcar, maní, colorantes, canguil, panela. Las compras las realizará en Guaranda y Chimbo. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá incrementar el negocio y adquirir materia prima.
El sueño es mejorar el nivel de vida y de la familia. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol.
texts.en:
Blas Mesias is 39 years old, married, and has two children.  He lives with her husband and children in San Jose Chimbo in the Bolivar province. 

Blas Mesias makes confectionary items all around.  He is asking for this loan to buy sugar, corn, colors, popcorn, and brown sugar.  He will make his purchases in Guaranda and Chimbo and will be able to increase his business with the help of this loan so he can buy supplies.

His dream is to improve his family’s quality of life.  His challenges are competition.  He likes to play soccer in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Tule

texts.es: Tule compró insumos y materias primas conlas que fabricó uniformes en el marco de pedidos de su clientela institucional. Ella pudo sacar a tiempo la producción de vestidos escolares y deportivos. En su negocio hay gran variedad y agregó mercancia que combinan con la ropa que leabora, como accesorios, productos de belleza etc y esto es gracias a su credikiva. Su mensaje a los finaciadores es Muy agradecida por el inmenso apoyo recibido por Kiva en los créditos que le ha aprobado. Su nuevo crédikiva, al que ahora aplica, lo invertira en mercancia variada, productos que ofrece sus catalogos con buenos descuentos y en ropa interior.
texts.en:
Tule bought the supplies and materials she needed to produce the school uniforms ordered by her institutional clients. She was able to find the time to make other school and sports clothing. In her business there is a great variety of merchandise, including clothing and accessories, beauty products, etc. Tule says her business has grown this way thanks to her loans from Kiva. 

She sends a thankful message to Kiva lenders for the great support Kiva has given her through her previous loans. This time, Tule is requesting a loan to stock her store with various discounted products that she has found in her catalogs as well as underwear.

loans.use: to buy underwear and various discounted catalog products to sell.

loans.name: Elsia Magdalena

texts.es:
Elsia tiene 36 años de edad de  estado civil casada no tiene hijos vive con el esposo  en el Recinto TARIRA perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla RENACER se encuentra ubicada el  recinto TARIRA, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Elsia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. 

El sueño es comprar un vehiculo para el trabajo. En los tiempos libres le gusta caminar por el campo
texts.en:
Elsia is 36 years old and is married.  She has no children but lives with her husband in the Tarira area of the Ventanas Province district of Los Ríos.

She is a member of the Renacer communal bank, which is located in the Tarira area of the Ventanas Province district and works in the fields of fishing and agriculture.

Elsia works in agriculture, sowing corn and rice.  With this loan, she is able to buy materials such as fertiliser and insecticide to avoid pests and diseases.  She will buy these in the city of Ventanas. The loan has helped her to increase her income and her crops.

Her dream is to buy a vehicle for work.  In her free time she likes to go for walks in the country.

loans.use: compost, fertilisers and insecticides to avoid pests and diseases.

loans.name: Susana Ayquel

texts.es:
Susana tiene 52 años de edad es de  estado civil soltera no tiene hijos vive con los padres  en el Recinto TARIRA perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla RENACER se encuentra ubicada el  recinto TARIRA, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Susana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. 

El sueño es comprar una casa. En los tiempos libres le gusta pasar en la casa con la familia.
texts.en:
Susana is 52 years old. She is single and has no children. She lives with her parents in the community of TARIRA, which belongs to the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province. 

She belongs to the RENACER group, which is located in the community of TARIRA, in the Ventanas canton. It is dedicated to farming and fishing activities. 

Susana is a farmer. She grows corn and rice. With the loan, she will be able to buy materials such as fertilizer, manure, and insecticide to avoid pests and disease. She buys her materials in the city of Ventanas. The loan has helped her to increase her income and her crops.

Her dream is to buy a house. In her free time, she likes to be at home with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, and insecticide to avoid pests and disease.

loans.name: Clarita Adelaida

texts.es:
Clarita tiene 22 años es de estado civil soltera no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el Recinto TARIRA perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla RENACER se encuentra ubicada el  recinto TARIRA, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Clarita se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. 

El sueño es comprar un carro para el trabajo. En los tiempos libres le gusta dormir y salir a las dicotecas con las amigas.
texts.en:
Clarita is 22 years old.  She is single and lives with her parents in the Tarira area of the Ventanas Province district of Los Ríos.

She is a member of the Renacer communal bank, which is located in the Tarira area of the Ventanas Province district and works in the fields of fishing and agriculture.

Elsia works in agriculture, sowing corn and rice. With this loan, she is able to buy materials such as fertiliser and insecticide to avoid pests and diseases. She buys these in the city of Ventanas. The loan has helped her to increase her income and her crop yield.

Her dream is to buy a car for work.  In her free time she likes to sleep and to go out to clubs with her friends.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilisers and insecticides to avoid pests and diseases.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia, de 26 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Es conviviente con Juan quien se dedica al transporte y padre de sus 2 hijos de 7 y 1 años de edad. Juntos viven en  su propia casa que compraron con mucho esfuerzo.
La actividad que realiza Patricia es la venta de frutas y refrescos, para eso cuenta con una mesa que instala todos los días por las mañanas en el frontis de su casa, donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes que son sus vecinos ganándose sus amistad. 
Se inició hace más de 02 años con un capital propio y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su hermana en la atención.
Considera  su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y la demanda que tiene sus productos.
Se decidió empezar su negocio por necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar y así poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos a quienes quiere mucho. Viendo los buenos resultados que esta teniendo con su negocio, desea continuar y mantener su negocio. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de su mercadería necesaria para su negocio como las frutas frescas, buscando conseguir precios bajos por el volumen de sus compras.
texts.en:
Patricia is 26 years old and is a hardworking, dedicated woman with a great desire to get ahead.  She lives with Juan, who provides transportation services.  They have two children, ages 7 and 1 and all live together in a home of their own.

Patricia sells fruits and soft drinks.  She sets up a table in front of her house each morning, where she happily serves her customers who are also her neighbors.  She started this two years ago with her own money and her sister helps in serving customers.

She considers this business to be profitable because of the earnings and the demand for her products.

She decided to start this business out of necessity for an income to help her husband with the household expenses and to provide a better quality of life for her children, whom she loves very much.  She wants to continue her business because of the good results.  Therefore this will be her third loan through MFP.  She is hoping for your cooperation so that she can solidify her plans.  She is also happy to be a part of her communal bank because the members are united and responsible people.  She will use the 1,500 PEN from this loan to buy merchandise that she needs for her business, such as fresh fruit.  She is looking for volume prices.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en: Teimuraz is from the Khashuri district. He is 46 years old, married, and lives with his wife, a 7-year-old daughter and parents, who are retired. His wife works as an apothecary and receives a monthly income. Teimuraz receives a small amount of income from his store, selling fruits and vegetables. As the existing income is not enough for the family, Teimuraz decided to start a new business. He plans to finish renovating an additional store and to rent it out for a good price. Teimuraz has applied for loans from local financial institutions several times, for a business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of his lack of experience in the new business, as experience is usually a requirement of local credit providers. However, his loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up and re-start credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, since they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. With this loan, Teimuraz will repair his newly built store and renovate it properly so that it satisfies the needs of his clients. Teimuraz hopes his business will be profitable and that this will increase his income, providing his family with enough money to satisfy their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate an additional store store to rent out.

loans.name: Urjinhand

texts.en:
Urjinhand is 57 years old and lives with her husband and her son in their small house in Selenge province in Mongolia. Her husband, Gantulga, age 58, has a business in the local market - a book, newspaper and magazine store. Her youngest son, Ganbat, studies in Mongolian National University. Urjinhand was working at a company for years and is now retired and stays home helping her husband to run his newspaper stand, and also to run her small retail clothes market. 

They have been living in their house for years and needed some renovation and insulation. So she is now requesting 6,000,000MNT to purchase construction materials, vacuum windows and a new heating system and install it in their house to reduce heat loss and stay warm during harsh and cold Mongolian winter. She and her husband are hardworking, enthusiastic and positive people.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, vacuum windows and a new heating system and install it in their house to reduce heat loss and stay warm during the harsh and cold Mongolian winter.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталья  - фермер. С 1987 года занимается выращиванием клубники, смородины, винограда, помидор и зерновых культур.
Справляться по хозяйству ей помогает муж, и двое приемных детей 10-ти  и 11 лет.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания лука и сада, в котором выращивают деревья абрикоса, черешни, персика, груши и яблок.
Наталья с мужем решила приобрести оборудование для скважины и насос, т.к. в данной местности существуют  большие проблемы с водой для полива, особенно в летний период  засухи, полив виноградника приходится осуществлять вручную.
В планах на будущие:  расширить посадку новых сортов винограда и малины, а также в планах поставить теплицу для выращивания клубники.
В личных планах: на будущее приобрести жилье для приемных детей, обеспечить их образованием .
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования оборудования для скважины.
texts.en:
Nataliya is a farmer.  Since 1987 she has been growing strawberries, currants, grapes, and tomatoes, as well as raising cereal crops.  
Her husband and her two adopted children, aged 10 and 11 years, help her with the farm.  She began the business growing onions and running an orchard where they have apricot, cherry, peach, pear, and apple trees.

Nataliya and her husband decided to buy equipment for a well and a pump since there are many problems with water for irrigation in their area, especially during the summer dry period, when they have to water the grape vines by hand.

Among her future plans are to expand her plantings with new varieties of grapes and raspberries, as well as to build a greenhouse for growing strawberries.  Among her personal plans, she wants to buy homes for her adopted children and to provide them with an education.

She needs your help to finance the purchase of the well and pump equipment.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Henrry Javier

texts.es:
Henrry tiene 45 años de edad es de  estado civil Union Libre no tiene hijos vive con la compañera en el Recinto TARIRA perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla RENACER se encuentra ubicada el  recinto TARIRA, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Henrry se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. 

El sueño es comprar un moto para el trabajo. En los tiempos libres le gusta ir al rio a pensar.
texts.en:
Henrry is 45 years old.  He has no children but lives with his partner in the Tarira area of the Ventanas Province district of Los Ríos.

He is a member of the Renacer communal bank, which is located in the Tarira area of the Ventanas Province district and works in the fields of fishing and agriculture.

Henrry works in agriculture, sowing corn and rice. With this loan, he is able to buy materials such as fertiliser and insecticide to avoid pests and diseases. He will buy these in the city of Ventanas. The loan has helped him to increase his income and his crops.

His dream is to buy a motorcycle for work. In his free time he likes to go to the river to think.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilisers and insecticides to avoid pests and diseases.

loans.name: Jovenes Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario jóvenes emprendedores, está conformado por tres personas jóvenes de la ciudad de Cayambe, jóvenes que buscan salir adelante frente a las adversidades de la vida y lo están logrando gracias al trabajo y al esfuerzo que ellos hacen día a día.
El presidente de este grupo solidario es Christian un joven de 22 años, que vive con su esposa en la parroquia rural de Cusubamba en la ciudad de Cayambe, Christian se define como una persona carismática, alegre, trabajador y emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante y brindarle a su esposa lo mejor.
El crédito solicitado a Fodemi se lo va a invertir en la compra de camisas y buzos negros para bordar con el logotipo de la policía y venderlos a ellos especialmente al grupo de antinarcóticos GEMA de la policía Ecuatoriana, este negocio lo inicio hace más de 2 años, dándoles excelentes resultado y mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
Christian tiene cumplir su sueño de que su esposa confeccione las camisas y buzos y el las borde y juntos como familia tener una microempresa de venta de ropa para las fuerzas policiales.
texts.en:
This group of young entrepreneurs is made up of three young people from the city of Cayambe.  These young people look for ways to get ahead and face life’s adversities and they are doing it thanks to their daily hard work and effort.

Christian is 22 years old and the group’s president.  He lives with his wife in the rural Cusubamba parish of the city of Cayambe.  Christian is known for being charismatic, happy, hardworking, enterprising, and with a great desire to get ahead and provide the best for his wife.

He is asking for a loan through Fodemi so that he can buy shirts and black sweatshirts that he can mark with police insignia and sell them to the GEMA antidrug squad of the Ecuadorian police.  He has had this business for more than two years and it has provided excellent results and he has managed to improve his family’s quality of life. 

Christian wants to achieve his dream of his wife making shirts and sweatshirts and for his family to have a small business, selling clothing to police forces.

loans.use: to buy shirts and sweatshirts.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a buffalo for her husband's livestock business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 48 years old, married, and the mother of three children. Virginia lives in Mangga, Tangub City.

For the last five years, she has earned a living by selling home products and second-hand products. On average, she explains that she earns approximately 2,300 PHP per month.

She is applying for a loan in the amount of 3,600 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. Virginia joined GDMPC in 2011 as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional products (e.g., canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee).

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo is a 62-year-old, married man from Ubay, Bohol. He and his wife have five grown-up children.

For more than ten years, he has been engaged in the hog-raising business, which is the primary source of his family's income.

Edgardo is requesting a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and to renovate the pigpen. Edgardo believes that this loan will help him increase his earnings.

loans.use: to expand and improve his business by purchasing additional piglets and renovating his pigpen

loans.name: Babken

texts.en: Babken lives in Goris town with his wife and 27-year-old daughter. Babken is involved in beekeeping. He keeps 32 colonies of bees from which he gets very tasty honey. Honey is  a must have item for each Armenian household, that's why there are always plenty of buyers of quality honey. As agriculture is the only source of income for this family, Babken wants to expand it. He has applied for this loan to purchase two cows and forage for feeding them. He will use their milk in cheese production and will sell it in the local market. This will increase Babken's income and enable him to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and forage for feeding them

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en una casa alquilada ocupando una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una Lap top, ya que le será de mucha ayuda en su trabajo, ya que el trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada de la ciudad de La Paz por más de ocho horas al día y con lo que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, pago de alquiler y pago de servicios básicos.
El sueño de Juan, es alquilar una casa en anticrético para tener más comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Juan is single, and he has no children.  He lives in a rented house, occupying one room.  The house is located in the Miraflores area of the city of La Paz.

The loan that he needs is to buy a laptop because it will be a great help to him in his work.  He works as an employee for over eight hours a day for a private company in the city of La Paz.  With what he earns he must cover expenses for food, rent, and basic services.

Juan’s dream is to rent a house by ‘anticrético’ [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you] in order be more comfortable and improve his quality of life.

This is the first time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and the first time from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to help with his work.

loans.name: Angel Ramiro

texts.es:
Angel tiene 28 años es de  estado civil casado  tiene una hija vive con la esposa y los hijos en el Recinto TARIRA perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla RENACER se encuentra ubicada el  recinto TARIRA, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Angel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. 

Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. 

El sueño es construir la casa. En los tiempos libres le gusta jugar futbol.
texts.en:
Angel is 28 years old and is married. He has one daughter.  He lives with her and his wife in the Tarira area of the Ventanas Province district of Los Ríos.

He is a member of the Renacer communal bank, which is located in the Tarira area of the Ventanas Province district and works in the fields of fishing and agriculture.

Angel works in agriculture, sowing corn and rice. With this loan, he is able to buy materials such as fertiliser and insecticide to avoid pests and diseases. 

He will buy these in the city of Ventanas. The loan has helped him to increase his income and his crop yield.

His dream is to build a house.  In his free time he likes to play football.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilisers and insecticides to avoid pests and diseases.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is a married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She and her husband have a five-year-old son.

For more than ten years, Erma and her husband have been engaged in the fishing business, which is the sole source of their income.

Erma is asking for a loan to buy materials for their fishing business (such as new fishing nets, lead weights, and fuel for the boat) and materials to renovate their house (e.g., nails and wood). Erma believes that this loan will both help her improve their fishing business and repair/improve their house.

loans.use: to purchase materials for their fishing business (e.g., new fishing nets, lead weights, and fuel for the boat) and additional materials to renovate their house (e.g., nails and wood)

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 35-year-old, married woman from Mangga, Tangub City. She and her husband have three children.

For six years now, Elena has been earning a living by growing and selling coconuts. She explains that she typically earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month from her business.

Elena is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to grow. Elena joined GDMPC in 2009. She plans to use the additional revenue she expects to generate as a result of the loan to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional seeds, seedlings, and crops

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 22-year-old hard-working man with one child living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is transportation, specifically motorcycle transport, alongside dairy farming as additional income.

Like all good fathers, he desires to educate his child to attain a masters degree at the university. He desires to diversify his business to include dairy farming. James intends to use the loan to buy Fresian cows for dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy Fresian cows for dairy farming.

loans.name: Chenda's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village in the Kandal Stoeng district, Chenda is a 43-year-old widow. She is blessed with four children, three of whom are employed as workers at a garment factory. This single mother (Chenda) supports the family through farming rice. Having been in the rice-growing business for more than 15 years, Chenda is able to earn around 19,000 KHR per day and save approximately 6,000 KHR after offsetting the daily costs of living. 

Chenda’s loan group consists of four female members, all of whom are first-time borrowers with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. As a group leader, she is leading her group to take out a loan in the amount of 160,000 KHR each. Chenda will utilize her loan portion to build a latrine for use in her family. This industrious mother will be able to create a healthier environment not only for herself but also for her beloved children. Chenda can also promote sanitation and hygiene practices in her community as well after having this latrine properly installed.

loans.use: To build a latrine in her home.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.es:
Jeannette, es soltera y tiene un hijo que estudia en la Universidad, viven en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones pequeñas, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Ella trabaja organizando conferencias y seminarios en el área de turismo, y no tiene muchos ingresos es por eso que cubren los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos con la manutención que le da el papá de su hijo.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar una Lap top ya que le será de mucha ayuda en los estudios a su hijo ya que esta en la universidad.
El sueño de Jeannette es mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y también junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Jeannette is single, and she has one child who is studying at the university.  They live in their own house, occupying two small rooms.  The house is located in the Sopocachi area of the city of La Paz.

She works organizing tourism conferences and seminars.  She does not have a lot of income. That is why she covers the expenses for food, education, and basic services with the support given to her by her child’s father.

She needs the loan to buy a laptop because this will be a great help for her son’s education.  He attends the university.

Jeannette’s dream is to improve her income and her quality of life.

This is the first time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and the first time from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for her child who is attending the university.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 54 años es de estado civil casada no tiene hijos vive con el esposo en el Recinto TARIRA perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla RENACER se encuentra ubicada el  recinto TARIRA, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Teresa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. 

El sueño es viajar en avion. En los tiempos libres le gusta alimentar a los chanchos.
texts.en:
Teresa is fifty-four years old and is married.  She does not have any children and lives with her husband in the district of Tarira, which belongs to the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province. 

She belongs to the communal bank RENACER, which is located in the district of Tarira, belonging to the Ventanas canton.  Members make a living in agricultural activities and in working with livestock.  

Teresa makes a living in agriculture, growing corn and rice.  With the loan, she will be able to buy materials like fertilizer, manure, and insecticide to avoid plant pests and diseases.  She will buy the items in the city of Ventanas.  The credit helps her to grow her income and crops.

Her dream is to travel in a plane.  In her free time, she likes to feed the pigs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, and insecticide to avoid plant pests and diseases.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a 36-year-old, married woman living in Masindi, Uganda. She is also a good mother, who hopes to educate her children to the university level.

She explains that she is a hardworking woman, and that she does a number of activities to earn a living. For example, she cleans at the local hospital (where she earns a monthly salary), raises and sells poultry, and sells fruit. Insufficient capital and price fluctuations on her goods are her major challenges.

Sofia is seeking this loan to buy chicken feed and fruit for re-sale purposes.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing chicken feed and additional fruit

loans.name: Olinda

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Olinda to improve her business.  She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own $100. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store like oil, sleepers, detergent, soap, and rice to resell them. Olinda is generating a good income from selling her things from the kiosk.
She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy oil, sleepers, detergent, soap, and rice

loans.name: Ma. Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Ma. Marilyn. She previously accessed a 14,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her general store business. Her earnings were a big help in paying for her children’s education as well as for their personal, household and business expenditures.
