Alfredo Alejandro works in agriculture, planting corn and rice. He buys his supplies in Ventanas and sells his products in the same place.

He is applying for the loan to purchase seeds, urea, supplies, and fertilizers. With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy what he needs to be able to plant. His dream is to have a house and a car. In his free time he likes to play sports and read the Bible.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, supplies, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Luzdina

texts.es:
Luzdina, de 60 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchos deseos de superación.  Está separada del padre de sus 03 hijos de  38, 30 y 27 años  de edad.  Vive en compañía de sus hijos y sus nietos a las que quiere mucho, habitando en su propia casa.
La actividad que realiza Luzdina es la venta de abarrotes  de primera necesidad los cuales compra en los centros comerciales de la  ciudad y los vende desde su propia casa a pedido. Su  bodega esta ubicada en un local en el frontis de su vivienda vende sus productos a sus vecinos a crédito cobrando diariamente. 
Lleva dedicándose a éste negocio  hace más de 05 años, tiempo que viene atendiendo de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes ganándose su preferencia.
Considera su negocio bastante rentable por  las ganancias que le deja en la venta al crédito, donde sube considerablemente sus precios.
Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en casa y cerca de sus nietos a quienes atiende con mucho amor. Además de brindarle un oficio, mantenerla ocupada y generarle un ingreso económico para poder apoyarse con  los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus nietos. Viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo con su negocio tiene planes de continuar  e incluso hacerlo crecer, adquiriendo más mercaderías para surtir y tener mayor variedad para ofertar. Por tanto éste será el  préstamo numero 03 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta con la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito, por eso se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, para tener un buen record crediticio y tener acceso a más créditos en el futuro. 
Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercaderías para surtir su negocio, como abarrotes de primera necesidad a precio por mayor  para así tener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Luzdina, who is 60 years old, is a hard working woman with a strong desire to succeed. She is separated from the father of her 3 children who are 38, 30 and 27 years old. She lives with her children and her grand children, in her own home.  

The business that Luzdina runs is a small grocery store; she purchases products that are needed on a daily basis in larger stores in the city and she resells them from her home and also takes orders. Her store is located in a room in the front of her house, where she sells products to her neighbors on credit, charging interest daily. She has had this business for more then 5 years, in which time she has treated her customers in a kind and friendly way and by doing so has earned their loyalty. She considers her business to be very profitable because of the money she receives from selling on credit, for which she raises her prices considerably. 

She likes her business because it allows her to work from home, close to her grandchildren who she takes care of with great love. Along with providing her with a job, the store also keeps her busy and provides her with an income to be able to help with household expenses as well as to help pay for the education of her grand children. Seeing the good results that she has had from her business, she has plans to continue and also to expand her business, purchasing more merchandise to stock her store and to have a larger variety of goods to offer.  

This is the third loan she has taken out through MFP. She is happy to have the opportunity to take out a loan. She promises to make her payments, in order to have a good credit record and be able to take out more loans in the future. 

With the 2000 nuevos soles she has requested, she will invest in purchasing more merchandise to stock her business, like basic needs products which she will buy at wholesale price in order to have higher profit margins.

loans.use: to buy staple products for her store.

loans.name: Kamalini

texts.en:
Kamalini is a 28-year-old unmarried lady living with her parents and her younger brother. She felt like a burden on her parents and her brother, so she planned to help her father financially and started a food production center (making different local snacks). She purchases the raw materials from the local market, prepares these with the help of her family members and packages these products. She takes orders from her customers from the local market and supplies them according to the customer's demands. Due to limited financial conditions, she is not able to meet the growing demand of the customers. She earns 2,000 INR per month from her snack business, which is not sufficient for her family.

She has a plan to purchase more raw materials for her business so that she can take more orders from her existing customers and increase her client base to earn more income. She says that she can earn up to 4,000 INR per month after purchasing more raw materials for her business.  She has requested a loan of 15,000 INR to purchase more raw materials. She wants to help her father and save some money for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials for her snack business

loans.name: Santilata

texts.en:
Santilata is a 32-year-old differently able lady living with her parents, husband and children. She owns and manages a Ladies Novelty Store where she sells bangles, bindis (forehead stickers), nail colors, lip colors, hair accessories, readymade garments and other fashion accessories. She earns 2,000 INR per month from this activity but this is not sufficient for her to run her family. Her husband is a fisherman. He goes to Chilika Lake (a famous lake for migratory birds) for fishing and sells the fish in the local market near to his village.

She has a plan to enhance her Ladies Novelty Corner by adding more products like cosmetics, hair oil, shampoo, body talc, body deodorant, and other fashion accessories. She says that doing so will improve her earnings and her family’s status. She has requested a loan of 30,000 INR for purchasing the above items for her Ladies Novelty Corner. 
 
She has dream of educating her children and helping her husband financially to manage the family.

loans.use: to  purchase cosmetics, hair oil, shampoo, body talc, body deodorant, and fashion accessories for her Ladies Novelty Corner.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
Socorro, de 30 años es una mujer soltera. Vive junto a su mamá y su hija Luisita a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de. Su principal ingreso económico se centra en la venta de ropa, tiene clientes fijos a los que visita constantemente, ellos le hacen pedidos a Socorro, quien compra las prendas para poder negociar, según comenta, hay fechas en las que ya le pagan por adelantado, pero otra sen las que tiene que dejar al contado. Ella entiende a todo ellos, pues su ventaje es ser carismática y muy solidaria. Paralelo a ese trabajo realiza la venta de productos de belleza por catálogos, vendiendo labiales, perfumes de reconocidas marcas. Además por las mañanas trabaja en una casa como empleada, realiza la comida y la limpieza, ahí obtiene un sueldo mensual con lo que puede cubrir los demás gastos familiares, pues cuida de su madre quien es anciana. Por ese lado, también recibe un sueldo de sus hermanos, quienes aportan para su madre.  Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, se siente feliz, pues tiene el capital necesario para mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida. Además le gusta pertenecer a su asociación, porque sus integrantes son personas solidarias y trabajadoras.
Socorro, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de zapatos escolares y uniformes para abastecer el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Socorro is 30 years old and single. She lives with her mother and her daughter, Luisita. She takes care of both of them in her own home.

Her main financial income comes from clothing sales. She has regular clients who visit her constantly and order clothes. She buys the clothing to trade. She says that on some days in which they pay in advance, and others in which customers pay in cash. She understands them all, because she has the advantage of being charismatic and supportive.

Aside from this work, she also sells beauty products from catalogs, such as lipstick and brand-name perfumes. She also works as a private employee in a house in the mornings. She makes food and cleans the house. She earns a monthly salary, which allows her to cover the rest of her family's expenses. She also cares for her mother, who is elderly. She receives a salary from her siblings, who make contributions for their mother.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. She is happy because she has the necessary capital to improve her business, and therefore her quality of life. She also enjoys belonging to her association, because the members are supportive and hardworking.

Socorro will invest this money in the purchase of school shoes and uniforms to fulfill her clients' orders.

loans.use: to buy school shoes and uniforms.

loans.name: Evarista

texts.es:
Evarista tiene 47 años, actualmente viuda, pero con dos grandes motivaciones que son sus hijos Michael y Edwin, uno de los cuales aun pequeño requiere todo el apoyo que solo su abnegada labor le podría brindar. Es propietaria de una vivienda a base de material noble. 
Desde tiempos de antaño ella y su esposo, han logrado establecer en un negocio dedicado a la venta de prendas de vestir así como la de zapatillas para las personas que laboran en el campo.
Considera su actividad muy rentable puesto que los productos que expende son netamente para la gente cuya labor principal son las actividades agrícolas, adicional a ello complementa su trabajo con el servicio de sastrería que inició hace poco por ser una actividad muy entretenida mientras no hay presencia de clientes en su negocio.
 Para iniciar el año con buena vibra  y un negocio bien surtido como es de su agrado desea contar con capital de trabajo para adquirir zapatillas y prendas de vestir que poseen mayor demanda en su negocio.
Tiene planeado a futuro cambiar de lugar y hacer una nueva vida en una ciudad más grande afrontando así un nuevo reto conjuntamente con su negocio. Con los 3,000 nuevos  soles surtirá su negocio con la compra de prendas de vestir consistente en zapatillas para el campo y demás prendas como pantalones, polos entre otros.
texts.en:
Evarista is 47 years old and now a widow. Her two greatest motivations are her sons, Michael and Edwin, one of whom, although small, requires all the help that her hard work can provide for him. She owns a house made of quality materials. 

Long ago, Evarista and her husband started a business to sell clothing, such as shoes for people who work on farms.

Evarista considers her activity very profitable since the products that she sells are purely for people who work in agriculture.  She also complements this work with the tailor service that she recently started as a way to entertain herself when there were no clients in her store.

To start the year with good vibes and a well stocked business, Evarista needs money to buy shoes and articles of clothing that are in high demand at her store.

In the future, Evarista plans to move and make a new life in a bigger city, facing a new challenge with her business. With the 3,000 Peruvian Nueves Soles, she will stock her business with articles of clothing such as shoes for farming.  She will also buy other articles of clothing, like pants and polo shirts among others.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing and shoes

loans.name: Fortaleciendonos Juntos Con Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Fortaleciéndonos juntos con Esperanza” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de joyas de plata, venta de café, manteles, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Lota.
Yoni, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentado en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste camisa de color celeste, su cabello lo usa corto de color gris.
EL se dedica al rubro de arreglos varios, desde hace 10 años. Comenta que trabaja en su casa y otras veces a domicilio de su clientela, ofrece arreglos de lavadoras, cocinas, realiza cercos de ante jardín en las casas, lo que su clientela le pide el lo realiza.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando  como repuestos los compra en diferentes ferreterías y otras veces les dice a su clientela que las compré y el realiza el cobro del trabajo.
Con el crédito comprará solamente herramientas.
Una de las metas de Yoni es continuar con su rubro, poder ayudar a su clientela cuando le ocurra algún imperfecto y el pueda acudir y solucionar el problema, así también generar mayores ingresos para darles un buen pasar a su familia.
Yoni vive junto a su familia que se compone de su esposa y dos hijos de 11 y 15 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral crecer dia a dia en su rubro, y a nivel familiar darles un buen pasar a su familia para que no le falte nada.
El está muy contento y agradecido de la ayuda brindada por Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Lota significa en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches, "pequeño lugarejo”. Es una comuna costera ubicada cerca de la ciudad de Concepción al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Lota es célebre por sus grandes yacimientos carboníferos muy ligados a la historia y desarrollo económico de Chile, así como por sus trabajadores de la minería subterránea, cuyas difíciles condiciones de vida fueron descritas por el escritor chileno Baldomero Lillo en su libro "Subterra".
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Fortaleciéndonos juntos con Esperanza” (Strengthening Ourselves Together With Hope). It is composed of 17 entrepreneurs who work in different areas, among which are: clothing sales, cosmetics sales, selling silver jewelry, selling coffee and tablecloths, and services, among others. They all live in the city of Lota.

Yoni, a member of the communal bank, in the picture is seated in the front row second from the right, wearing a sky blue shirt. His hair is short and gray. He has worked making various repairs for 10 years. He says that he works in his house and sometimes in his clients’ houses. He offers repairs of washing machines, kitchens, and garden fences in front of houses; whatever his client asks for, he does. 

He purchases the merchandise and supplies that he needs for spare parts in different hardware stores; other times, he tells his client that he will buy them, and he collects the payment for work. With the loan, he will only buy tools.

One of Yoni’s goals is to continue with his repairing, to be able to help his clients when something breaks so he can come and solve the problem. In this way, he can also generate more earnings to give his family a better time.

Yoni lives together with his family, which is made up of his wife and two children of 11 and 15 years. His dreams for work are to grow day by day in his repairing, and on a family level, to give a good life to his family so that they don’t lack for anything.

He is very happy and grateful for the help offered by Fondo Esperanza to invest in his business. With respect to the communal bank group of which he forms a part, he says that there is very good communication within it. On the other hand, the education and training has allowed him to learn new strategies for sales and bookkeeping. 

In Mapudungun, the language of the indigenous Mapuches, “Lota” means “little village”.  It is a coastal community located close to the city of Concepción in southern Chile, in the Bíobío region. Lota is renowned for its large coal deposits, which are strongly tied to the history and economic development of Chile, as well as for its underground mine workers, whose difficult living conditions were described by the Chilean author Baldomero Lillo in his book “Subterra”.

loans.use: to purchase tools.

loans.name: Pradeep

texts.en:
Pradeep is a resident of the town of Khurda, in Odisha. He is 34 years old and staying with his parents, wife and children. He has been supporting his family through the income earned from a small vegetable and grocery store. He sells food items like potatoes, onions, wafers, green vegetables, detergents, rice, wheat flour, snacks, spices, electric bulbs and other household items in his village. He has had it for the last eight years. 

He needs a loan of 30,000 INR in order to buy more stock of snacks, spices and other household necessities like toilet cleaners, mosquito repellents and wafers for his shop. He says there is good demand for mosquito repellents and sanitizers as mosquito borne diseases are very widely prevalent in his village. He wants to increase his income and save some money for his family's future.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, spices and other household necessities like toilet cleaners, mosquito repellents and wafers for his shop

loans.name: Johnny Andres

texts.es:
Johnny Andres tiene 29 años vive en unión libre junto a la pareja tiene una nena de meses de edad. Vive con la esposa y con la hija en Ventanas provincia de los rìos.

La ventanilla LA VERDAD NOS HARA LIBRES  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Johnny Andres se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de insumos, urea, fertilizantes, líquidos para la siembra del maíz, arroz. El préstamo le ayudado a  comprar los fertilizantes. En los tiempos libres le gusta jugar indor y le gusta comer chaulafan
texts.en:
Johnny Andres is 29 years old and lives in a common-law marriage. The pair has a 9-month-old daughter. The family resides in Ventanas, in De los Rios province.

His communal bank, “La Verdad Nos Hara Libres” [The Truth Will Make Us Free]. is located in Recinto Caimito, in Ventanas canton. The bank focuses on agricultural laborers who grow corn and rice on the short cycle.

Johnny Andres, too, is dedicated to planting corn and rice. In addition, he raises hens. Johnny Andres purchases his supplies in Ventanas and sells his products in the market at the same locale.

The loan he solicits is for purchasing supplies, urea, fertilizers, and liquids to be used in planting corn and rice. The loan will aid him especially in buying fertilizers. 

In his free time, Johnny Andres likes to play indoor sports and his favorite local dish is “chaulafan” [Ecuadorian style chicken fried rice].

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs, including urea, fertilizers, and liquids.

loans.name: John

texts.es:
John de 35 años comparte una linda vida conyugal con Ruth su compañera de toda la vida, producto del amor familiar que ambos comparten tiene a su pequeña Katerin de 11 años. Poseen una vivienda construida a base de material noble que lograron hacerla suya con muchos años de trabajo.
Anteriormente dedicado a la actividad de camionero recorriendo diversos puntos de su región decidió ingresar al rubro comercial de la venta de abarrotes con la finalidad de pasar más tiempo con su familia. Es así como con el firme apoyo y liderazgo de Ruth vienen desde hace 15 años liderando su negocio ubicado en el mercado de su localidad.
Se iniciaron de a pocos con la venta de abarrotes menores  y gracias al trabajo constante y buena atención que le brindan a sus hoy caseros lograron expandir su negocio hasta convertirlo en una sólida fuente de ingreso para el sustento de su economía familiar logrando hoy vender desde verduras, abarrotes y todo lo necesario para abastecer la lista de las amas de casa que acuden a ellos a diario. Es una buena manera de salir adelante sin tener que alejarte de los que mas quieres, comenta muy contento.
Al iniciarse la campaña de fin de año desea reabastecer su negocio con los productos de primera necesidad adquiriéndolos al por mayor para generar ingresos extra, asimismo desea realizar la compra de un lote de panetones.
Tienen el deseo de a futuro convertirse en proveedor mayoristas de productos considerados primera necesidad a comercios del rubro ubicados en zonas rurales ya que consideran sería una buena manera de generar ingresos. Con los 3,500 nuevos soles que solicita, podrá abastecerse de víveres de primera necesidad así como panetones que dejan buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
John, who is 35 years old, shares a nice life with his life partner, Ruth. The fruit of their loving relationship is their young daughter, Katerin, who is 11 years old. They own a house built with high quality materials, which they succeeded in building after many years of hard work. 

Before John made a living working as a truck driver, covering diverse routes in the region, but decided to start a business selling groceries so that he would have more time with his family. With the strong support and leadership provided by Ruth, he has now run his business in the local market for 15 years. They started with just a small amount of groceries, but thanks to constant work and the good service they provide to their customers they have succeeded in expanding their business so that it is now a solid source of income which sustains their family. They now sell vegetables, groceries, and everything that is needed by the home makers that visit their business on a daily basis. John happily commented, that it is a good way to be able to get ahead, without having to be far away from those that he loves.

Entering into the New Year, John wants to be able to restock his store with the basic necessities, buying them at wholesale price so that he earns the most profit; he also wants to buy "panetones" (a traditional sweet bread, similar to fruitcake, that is commonly eaten around Christmas and New Years).

He would like to some day become a wholesale provider of basic needs products to small grocery stores located in rural areas, because he thinks it would be a good source of income. With the 3,500 nuevos soles he has requested he will be able to restock his store with products of daily need and buy "panetones", which provide good profit.

loans.use: to buy basic need products and panetones (a traditional sweet bread).

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 31-year-old married man and the father of one child. He has worked as a barber for ten years now, and he is talented in his field, with a special emphasis on customer service. His three previous Kiva loans helped him significantly improve his business tools, machines and decor. 

Today Ali is applying for his fourth Kiva loan, with which he will expand his services by dividing his shop into two businesses: the barber shop, plus a new business selling mobile phones for additional income. Ali hopes to stay up to date with new products for both businesses. One day, as his business grows, he hopes to open an international call center, a profitable business in his area.

loans.use: to open a mobile phone business next to his barber shop.

loans.name: Martin Manuel

texts.es:
Martín Manuel tiene 40 años es casado y vive con su cónyuge y con los tres hijos Vive en Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

La ventanilla el LA VERDAD NOS HARA LIBRES   se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente las Lomas, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz, fréjol y soya.

Martín Manuel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, así también se dedica a la labor de maestro constructor.  Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, urea, ranger, insumos, abonos para la siembra del maíz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas el cogollero, la langosta, el ratón en los cultivos. El sueño es comprar terrenos para sembrar m{as maíz y arroz.

En los tiempos libres me gusta jugar futbol.
texts.en:
Martín Manuel is 40 years old.  He is married and lives with his spouse and three children in Ventanas in the Los Ríos Province.

The communal bank La Verdad Nos Hará Libres is located in the San Vicente las Lomas precinct in the canton of Ventanas. This communal bank focuses on agricultural works in short cycle planting of corn, rice, beans, and soy. 

Martín Manuel makes a living planting corn.  He also works as a master builder.  He makes both his purchases and his sales in Ventanas. 

He is requesting the loan to buy seeds, urea (fertilizer), ranger (a type of pesticide), supplies, and manure to sow corn. The loan has helped him to increase his income for his family to use. He is challenged by plagues of armyworms, locusts and mice in his crops. His dream is to buy land to plant more corn and rice.

In his free time, he likes to play soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea (fertilizer), ranger (a type of pesticide), supplies, and manure to sow corn

loans.name: Angelita Magdalena

texts.es:
Angelita Magdalena tiene 45 años vive en unión libre junto a la pareja tiene un hijo de 25 años de edad, vive en Ventanas Provincia de los rìos.

La ventanilla  LA VERDAD NOS HARA LIBRES  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto el Caimito 1, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Angelita Magdalena se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz.  Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mismo lugar.

El crédito solicita para la compra de semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, ranger  para la siembra del maíz,   El préstamo le ayudado para comprar los fertilizantes. el sueño es contar siempre con la ayuda de la cooperativa y la organización kiva para poder sembrar. Los desafìos a los que se enfrentan son las plagas y tener una buena producción.

En los tiempos libres le gusta alabar a Dios.
texts.en:
Angelita Magdalena is 45 years old. She lives with her common-law partner and has a 25-year-old son. She lives in Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios.

The communal bank "La Verdad Nos Hara Libres" (The Truth Will Set Us Free) is located in the Caimito 1 district, which is part of the Ventanas canton. The members of this communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture, planting corn and rice.

Angelita Magdalena works in agriculture, planting corn and rice. She buys her supplies in Ventanas and sells her products in the same place.

She is applying for the loan to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizers, and Ranger (weed killer) to plant corn. The loan will help her buy the fertilizers. Her dream is to always have the help of the cooperative and the Kiva organization to be able to plant. The challenges that she faces are plagues and having a good production.

In her free time she likes to praise God.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizer, and Ranger (weed control) to plant corn

loans.name: Frine

texts.es:
Con 33 años de edad Frine tiene el orgullo de pertenecer a una familia muy cariñosa y de amplia responsabilidad laboral, junto a Marcelino su pareja y sus dos retoños Frank y Katerin siente que tiene una motivación envidiable. Gracias a su trabajo en conjunto ha logrado construir el primer piso de su vivienda.
Muy trabajadora optó por dedicarse a las actividades agrícolas consistentes en la producción de cacao orgánico gracias a las parcelas que recibió por parte de sus padres en calidad de herencia, pues al encontrarse ya mayores optaron por abandonar la actividad que por muchos años fue el sustento de su familia.
Lleva 6 años a cargo de dichas parcelas y con el apoyo de Marcelino viene dedicándose de lleno al mantenimiento periódico de los árboles cacaoteros. Le agrada desempeñarse en el campo puesto que es una labor abnegada fuera de problemas y complicaciones dependiendo mucho del esfuerzo que uno le aplique, ya que el obtener buenas mazorcas termina siendo beneficioso en cuanto al precio final que los acopiadores le otorgan.
Al encontrarse en medio de la campaña productiva de cacao es necesario realizar un segundo deshierbo periódico, puesto que será necesario contar con la mano de obra por parte de jornaleros por tratarse de una actividad algo complicada y trabajosa.
Sus planes a futuro apuntan a la construcción del segundo piso de su vivienda en beneficio de sus retoños a quienes dedica todo el resultado de su trabajo.  Con los 2,000 nuevos soles que solicita, complementará su capital para el segundo deshierbo de campaña que requieren sus plantaciones con ayuda de jornaleros del lugar, adicional a ello comprará algunos sacos de abono guano de aves.
texts.en:
At 33 years of age, Frine is proud to belong to a caring family with a strong sense of responsibility towards their work. Her partner, Marcelino, and her two young children, Frank and Katerin, are great motivation. Thanks to their work, together they have been able to build the first floor of their home.

She is very hardworking and so decided to work in farming, specifically growing organic cacao. For this activity she uses some plots of land that she inherited from her parents. They had decided to stop due to old age, but until that time it had sustained her family for many years. 

She has been farming this land for 6 years, supported by Marcelino. All her time is spent looking after the cocoa trees. She likes working in the fields as it is very rewarding work with no problems or complications, dependant largely on the effort put in. The benefits of producing good quality cacao pods can be appreciated in the final price offered by the dealers.

It is now the cacao growing season and so the plots must be weeded for the second time. As this task is quite complicated and laborious, help, in the form of short-term labourers, will be needed.

Her plans for the future include the construction of the second floor of her home, which would be good for her kids. All that she earns from her work is used for her children. 

With the 2,000 Nuevos Soles that she is requesting she will add to her existing capital to pay for the second weeding of the season with the help of local labourers. In addition to this, she will buy some bags of manure (guano).

loans.use: to hire labourers and buy organic fertiliser

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan Pablo tiene 35 años es soltero tiene dos hijos vive con los hijos en Ventanas Provincia de los rìos.

La ventanilla LA VERDAD NOS HARA LIBRES  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito 1, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Juan Pablo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Las compras y las Ventas lo hace en Ventanas.

El crédito lo solicita para la compra de semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, urea para las siembras.   El préstamo le ayudado para comprar los fertilizantes y obtener mejores ingresos con las cosechas. El sueño  es poder comprar un terreno. Los desafìos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas en los cultivos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Juan Pablo is 35 years old, is single and has two children.  He lives with his children in Ventanas in the province of Los Rios.  The communal bank "The Truth Will Set us Free" is located in the Recinto Caimito 1, in the canton of Ventanas.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle agricultural work such as the planting of corn and rice.

Juan Pablo works in agriculture planting corn and rice.  He makes his purchases and completes sales in Ventanas.

He is requesting this loan to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizers and urea for planting.  The loan will help him to buy fertilizers and to get better income from his crops.

His dream is to be able to buy some land.  The challenges that he faces are the infestations that affect the harvests.  In his his free time he likes to play indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizers, and urea for planting.

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is 33 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in the village of Shindisi, near Georgia's capital city. His wife is unemployed; the children go to the local school. The family's business is animal husbandry, particularly pigs. Zaza keeps pigs in the shed located in his yard. He raises them, then sells them in the open market of the capital city. 

Zaza has requested loans from local financial institutions several times to start a trading business, but without any success. His loan requests were always rejected because of his family’s low income and poor living conditions. 

Then he requested a loan from Credo to re-start a retail business. His loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program provides credit to the rural poor who cannot otherwise access credit because their low income causes others to regard them as "high risk borrowers." 

The store building for Zaza's new business is located in the village and it is closed now. With the loan from Credo and Kiva, Zaza will be able to purchase stock for his store, selling flour and cattle feed such as bran. This growth will positively impact the family by hopefully doubling their small income, thus enabling them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase flour and bran to start a new store.

loans.name: Daniel Eliceo

texts.es:
Daniel Eliceo tiene 34 años es casado, vive con la cónyuge y sus tres hijos en Ventanas Provincia de Bolívar

La ventanilla LA VERDAD NOS HARA LIBRES  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito 1 , perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Daniel Eliceo  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Desde hace cinco años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, líquido mata plagas. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para comprar alimentación medicina pagar el médico. El sueño  es poder comprar un terreno y una casa.
En los tiempos libres me gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Daniel Eliceo, 34, is married and lives with his spouse and their three children in the Ventanas Province of Bolívar.  La Verdad Nos Hará Libres (The Truth Will Make Us Free) Communal Bank is located in Caimito 1 Precinct, part of Ventanas Canton. This communal bank's members make their livings in short-cycle agricultural work, harvesting corn and rice.

Daniel Eliceo makes a living harvesting corn, and has done so for the past five years. He buys supplies in Ventanas and sells his crops in a market in the same place. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds, inputs, fertilizers and insecticide. 

The loan will help him to increase his income to buy food and medicine, and pay the doctor. His dream is to be able to buy land and a house. In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizers, and insecticide

loans.name: Atesh

texts.en:
Atesh lives in the Marneuli District of Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife, their two children, and his parents, who are pensioners. Atesh owns a plot of land where he grows potatoes to sell at the local open market. 

Atesh applied for credit to start a fruit and vegetable trading business. His loan request was approved through a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The program provides business loans with easy repayment conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to traditional credit products - they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the loan, Atesh will purchase a car and will start a new business: He will purchase fruits and vegetables from farmers at wholesale prices and sell them in nearby towns. The family's income will increase and, as a result, they'll be able to improve their living conditions. Hopefully, this rise in income will also help them qualify for traditional credit in their country, just in case they need future loans.

loans.use: to purchase a car to use in his fruit and vegetable trading business.

loans.name: Lo Mejor Esta Por Venir Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Lo mejor está por venir” está conformado por 15 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, imprenta, venta de productos lácteos, articulos de temporada, venta de perfumes, comida rápida, venta de helados, servicios varios. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Renca, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Gisela, presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie, ocupando el sexto lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste polera de color negro y pantalones color Calipso, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica  a la venta de comida, desde hace 5 años. Comenta que trabaja en su casa, en ferias libres, ofrece también en los jardines de colegios a vecinos, vendiendo pastel de choclo, humitas, helados, jugos naturales, pizza, completos, ensaladas de frutas.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en la vega central que se ubica en la ciudad de Santiago, donde encuentra la verdura fresca y de buena calidad a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará dos toldos, fuente para el chocolate, mesas y sillas.
Una de las metas de Gisela es crecer dia a dia, y vender toda su producción de comida a su clientela, y continuar trabajando en las ferias libres ya que en ellas tiene mucha más clientela, así con esto optar por una mejor calidad de vida.
Gisela vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos de 18 y 4 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral, personal y familiar es cuidar y mantener su negocio como hasta el dia de hoy para darle un buen pasar económico a su familia.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida por el apoyo brindado por Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe una muy buena comunicación y respeto. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Renca es una comuna ubicada en el sector norponiente del Santiago (capital de Chile), región metropolitana. Es una comuna con un fuerte trabajo comunitario, entre lo que se destaca el canal de televisión comunitario “Renca TV”, creado con el fin de promover las actividades culturales y artísticas de la comuna.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Lo mejor está por venir" (The Best is Yet to Come) and is made up of 15 entrepreneurs who work in different business sectors. These include sale of beauty products by catalog, printing, sale of dairy products, seasonal items, sale of perfumes, fast food, sale of ice cream, and various services. They are all from the Renca commune, located in the city of Santiago.

Gisela is the chair of the communal bank group. In the photo she is seen standing, sixth from right to left, wearing a a black top and calypso blue pants. Her hair is dark brown and she wears it pulled back. 

She has been selling food for five years. She says that she works from home, in street markets and also sells in the schoolyards to neighbors. She sells pastel de choclo (sweet corn casserole), humitas (steamed corn cakes), ice cream, natural juices, pizza, meals and fruit salads. 

She buys the merchandise and ingredients she needs in the Vega Central produce market located in the city of Santiago, where she finds fresh, good-quality vegetables that are low cost and therefore affordable. With the loan she will buy two sunshades,a chocolate fountain, tables and chairs.

One of Gisela's goals is to grow day by day and to sell all of her food production to her clientele. She wants to continue working at the street markets, as there she has many more customers. This way she can aspire to a better quality of life.

Gisela lives with her husband and two children, ages 18 and 4. Her dream for her work and at a personal and family level is to look after her business and keep it going as it has up to now, so that she can give her family a prosperous future. 

She is very happy and grateful for the support offered by Fondo Esperanza for investing in her business. With respect to the communal bank to which she belongs, she comments that there is good communication and respect. Moreover, the training has helped her learn new sales strategies, as well as accounting. 

Renca is a commune located in the northwest sector of the Santiago metropolitan region (Santiago the capital of Chile). It is a commune with a strong emphasis on community action, in which the community television channel, "Renca TV," stands out. This was created with the aim of promoting the commune's cultural and artistic activities.

loans.use: To buy two sunshades, a chocolate fountain, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

Cresencia has been in this business for nine years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Cresencia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Blanca Judith

texts.es:
Blanca Judith tiene 24 años es soltera, vive con los  padres y los hijos en Ventanas 

La ventanilla LA VERDAD NOS HARA LIBRES  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito 1 , perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Blanca Judith  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Desde hace cinco años. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agricolas lo hace en Ventanas. 

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas,urea, insumos, fertilizantes, ranger para las siembras. El préstamo le ayudará para comprar los productos sin ningún tipo de problema por el dinero. El sueño  es comprar una casa y un vehículo.

En los tiempos libres me gusta  escuchar música.
texts.en:
Blanca Judith is 24 years old and single. She lives with her parents and her children in Ventanas. The “La Verdad Nos Hará Libres” (The Truth Will Make Us Free) Communal Bank is in the Caimito 1 precinct in the Ventanas canton. This communal bank devotes itself to the short cycle farming of corn and rice. 

Blanca Judith has been growing corn for five years. She makes her purchases and sales of agricultural products in Ventanas. She requested the loan to buy seeds, urea, supplies, fertilizers, and herbicides for the harvests. The loan will help her buy the products without having problems due to her lack of money. 

Her dream is to be able to buy a house and a vehicle. In her free time she likes to listen to music.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, supplies, fertilizers and herbicides for the harvests

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 23 years old, single, and well-known in the community as a very ambitious young man. For the past two years, he has managed his own barber shop. The shop is very profitable and located in a good place in Rafah City, Palestine. 

Ahmad is looking to make some decor improvements to his shop, such as buying new mirrors and new chairs and installing lights. He took a USD youth loan from FATEN, Kiva's field partner. The shop improvements from the loan will help Ahmad attract more customers, which will increase his income and ensure a bright future. 

Ahmad appears in the photo inside his barber shop.

loans.use: to improve the interior of his barber shop

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo en casa propia; él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol además a la crianza de ganado para complementar los gastos del hogar; tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de mucha incidencia agrícola  muy cercano a la zona donde reside, comercia en todos los lugares aledaños y ya tiene mucha clientela pues todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente; Julio es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que se le presentan, en la última cosecha tuvo pérdidas y quiere recuperarse por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, fertilizante, insecticida, ganado, etc. Julio tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, esta muy agradecido con la ayuda por eso asegura que pagara la deuda y a la vez le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida llena de las comodidades que se merecen.
texts.en:
Julio lives with his life partner in a home of his own.  He is a farmer and raises corn and beans and also raises livestock to help meet the household expenses.  He has been doing this for several years and this experience allows him to obtain better harvests.  His farmland is located in a very agricultural zone near his home zone and he sells in the surrounding areas to many customers because he sells quality products, at good prices, with excellent service.

Julio is an enterprising man with many desires to get ahead and who is always looking for new opportunities.  He had some losses during his last harvest and he wants to recover, so he has requested a loan through INTEGRAL.  This will allow him to buy corn and bean seeds, and fertilizer, insecticide, livestock, etc.  Julio comes with good payment references and is a very responsible man.  He is very grateful for the assistance and is certain that he will be able to get out of debt and provide a better quality of life, full of comforts, to his family who deserves it.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Margoth

texts.es:
Margoth de 39 años tiene la satisfacción de contar con una familia sólida junto a Alipio de 42 años y  junto a sus dos pequeños hijos Cristian y Dany.
Gracias al esfuerzo conjunto de muchos años lograron culminar el primer nivel de su vivienda a base de material noble. 
Ella se dedica en la venta de calzados y lo hace de manera ambulante, asimismo ella y su esposo lograron desde hace 10 años aperturar una tienda surtida en la cual expenden diversos calzados como zapatos, sandalias entre otros para damas, caballeros y niños.
 Comenta que le agrada mucho su actividad puesto que hace reconfortante trabajar al lado de su esposo y contando con el apoyo en actividades menores de sus hijos. Dentro de sus principales clientes se encuentran personas cuya actividad principal son las actividades agrícolas y acuden a la ciudad para realizar sus compras rutinarias generando buenos ingresos a los comercios en general como es su caso.
Para reabastecer su negocio desea contar con capital de trabajo que le permita adquirir un nuevo lote de calzados consistentes en sandalias y zapatillas de nylon cuya demanda va en aumento en esta temporada del año.
Como parte de una motivación adicional desean seguir trabajando con el entusiasmo que los caracteriza para cumplir uno de sus objetivos a largo plazo que es el aperturar sucursales en su localidad. Con los 3,500 nuevos soles espera realizar la compra de un lote de calzados consistentes en sandalias y zapatillas de nylon para aprovechar el incremente de la demanda próximo.
texts.en: Margoth, 39, has the satisfaction of having a stable family together with Alipio, 42, and their two small children, Cristian and Dany. Thanks to the combined efforts of many years, they were able to finish the first level of their house, built from hard-wearing materials. She works as a street vendor, selling footwear. Ten years ago, she and her husband were able to open a store in which they sell assorted footwear like shoes, sandals, etcetera for men, women, and children. She says that she really likes her work because it is relaxing to work alongside her husband, and have her children's help for small tasks. Among her main customers are those who work as farmers and come to the city to make routine purchases, generating good incomes for sellers in general, such as in her case. She want working capital to restock her business with a new batch of footwear like sandals and slippers made of nylon. The demand for these shoes goes up this time of year. As an additional motivation, they are working with their characteristic enthusiasm to meet one of their long-term goals: opening branches in their community. With the 3,500 nuevos soles she hopes to buy a batch of sandals and slippers made of nylon to take advantage of the upcoming increase in demand.

loans.use: to buy sandals and slippers.

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es:
Xiomara de 36 años comparte una vida conyugal con José , ambos dedicados a su labor tiene la alegría de ser padres de 3 hijos quienes aún en edad estudiantil requieren todo el apoyo que ellos le puedan dar, es propietaria de una vivienda construida a base de material noble.
Desde tiempos atrás conoció a José donde juntos tenían un común que era el amor por la vida, motivo por el cual al culminar sus estudios superiores en la rama de la salud decidieron establecerse en un negocio propio en el ambiente cómodo de una vivienda que lograron adquirir después de muchos años de trabajo. Cumplen hasta hoy 8 años como independientes en los cuales gracias a proveedores confiables y buenos precios logran obtener medicinas para su centro de salud particular en beneficio de la población.
Ellos trabajan en conjunto en cuanto a diversos tipos de servicios de salud se requiera ya que gracias a su trabajo y honradez han logrado hacer de su negocio un gran sustento para su economía familiar.
Periódicamente se presentan ofertas en cuando a lotes de medicina se requiere, es por ello que desean contar con capital que les permita aprovechar dichas ofertas y a su vez adquirir medicinas de marca y genérico para abastecer su negocio por un periodo prolongado, esperando así seguir aportando a través de su trabajo al desarrollo social de su localida.
Sus objetivos a largo plazo apuntan a la ampliación su negocio convirtiéndolo en un gran centro de salud que tenga a su vez un área social en beneficio de la población más humilde de su localidad. Con los 3,500 nuevos soles que solicita, aprovechara la oferta de medicinas por parte de sus proveedores, así como la compra de medicinas de marca y genérico para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Xiomara is 36 years old and shares her married life with José, both of whom are dedicated to their work. They are the proud parents of 3 children who are still in education and require all the support they can give. Xiomara owns a house built with solid materials.

When she met José, a long time ago now, they shared a love for life. Once they had completed their higher level education in the area of health, this was their motivation for setting up their own business. They established the business in their house, as it is very convenient. However, it took them many years of work to acquire the house. 

They have been operating as independent traders for 8 years now. Thanks to their suppliers, who are reliable and offer good prices, they have been able to obtain medicines for their private health centre. This benefits the community. 

They work together, providing different types of healthcare services. As a result of their hard work and honesty the business is a main source of financial support for their family.

From time to time there are special offers on batches of medicines. For this reason, they would like to have capital, so that they can take advantage of these offers. They will also be able to acquire branded and generic medicines to stock the business for a longer period of time. This enables them to continue contributing, through their work, to the social development of their local area. 

Their long-term goals are to expand the business into a large health centre, which can also cater for the poorer people in the area. With this loan of 3,500 Nuevos Soles they will buy medicines on special offer from their suppliers and purchase branded and generic medicines to stock their business.

loans.use: to buy medicines

loans.name: Sonrisas Group

texts.es:
Sonrisas es un grupo solidario conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras, que buscan la manera de cumplir cada uno de sus sueños a base de trabajo y esfuerzo diario.
La presidenta de este grupo es la señora  Yasmina una mujer valiente llena  de virtudes y de altos valores cristianos, ella es una mujer de 31 años tiene tres hijos y junto a ellos viven en la ciudad de Cayambe. Yasmina es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, es por ello que se ha sabido ganar el aprecio y reconocimiento de su comunidad.
El crédito solicitado a FODEMI se lo invertirá en la compra de productos para el bazar papelería como la compra de cuadernos, materiales de oficina, papel, bisutería etc. Siendo una inversión muy rentable ya que Yasmina tiene su negocio hace mucho tiempo y es muy reconocida en la ciudad de Cayambe.

El sueño que la Sra. Yasmina tiene es seguir trabajando en su local para lograr construir su propia casa para darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sonrisas (Smiles) is a solidarity group made up of three entrepreneurial women, all of whom are looking for a way to fulfill their dreams through daily work and effort. 

The president of the group is Yasmina, a brave woman full of virtue and Christian values. She is 31 years old, has three children, and lives with them in the city of Cayambe. Yasmina is a very hard-working and enthusiastic woman, which is why she has been able to win the appreciation and recognition of her community. 

The loan she has requested from FODEMI will be invested in the purchase of products for her stationery bazaar, such as notebooks, office materials, paper, costume jewelry, etc. This will be a very profitable investment since Yasmina has had her business for a long time and is very well-known in the city of Cayambe.

Yasmina's dream is to continue working in her establishment to be able to build her own house to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy products for her stationery bazaar such as notebooks, paper, office supplies, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Filder

texts.es:
Filder de 32 años,lleva una agradable vida conyugal junto a Delaida de 40 años, ambos tienen la alegría y motivación que sus dos pequeños hijos Ariane y Renzo le brindan a su hogar. Reside en una vivienda construida a base de material noble. Inicialmente desempeñaba su labor como comerciante de manera ambulatoria para posteriormente gracias a su empeño establecerse en un local dentro del mercado de su localidad. Es por ello que hasta hoy lleva 8 años como comerciante en un local fijo, saliendo con un puesto temporal los fines de semana en la feria local que organiza la municipalidad de su distrito.
Durante todo este tiempo ha ido a través de los diversos calzados conquistar el gusto de sus clientes a quienes suele tratar con mucha atención y entusiasmo, logrando así hacer de su trabajo una gran manera de salir adelante. No obstante existen temporadas en la que la venta de los diversos calzados presenta poca demanda pero felizmente según comenta al tratarse de productos no perecible con un poco de ingenio es posible recuperar dicho capital.
Para la temporada de fin de año desea contar con capital para la compra de calzados en especial para niños por poseer de gran demanda en esta época del año.
Desea para en adelante seguir trabajando con la misma motivación que lo caracteriza para lograr ampliar su negocio hasta convertirlo en una gran tiendo de calzados y ropa como quiso desde que inició con el negocio. Este es su primer préstamo, agradecido por la oportunidad se siente muy confiado para con su inversión puesto que considera que es una gran herramienta de trabajo.
Siempre fue un comerciante conocido es por ello que sus compañeros tienen una buena referencia de el en cuando al cumplimiento de sus pagos y las buenas ideas que aporta.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles espera surtir su negocio con calzados para niños, esperando así sacarle una buena ventaja como comerciante a la campaña de fin de año.
texts.en:
Filder, 32, leads a pleasant married life with Delaida, 40.  Both have the happiness and motivation that their two small children, Ariane and Renzo, give to their home.  He lives in a home built of good materials.  In the beginning he carried out his job as a street vendor.  Later, thanks to his effort, he was able to set up in a space inside the town market.  This is why he now has eight years as a merchant in a fixed location.  He has a temporary spot in the local street fair organized by the town in his district on the weekend.

During all this time he has used a variety of footwear to captivate the taste of his customers, whom he treats attentively and enthusiastically, managing to make his job a great way of getting ahead.  Nevertheless, there are times when there's little demand for sales of the various shoes.  Happily, though, as he comments, it's possible to recover the capital with a bit of ingenuity when it's a matter of non-perishable products.

He wants to have capital for the end-of-the-year season to buy footwear, especially for children, because it's in high demand this time of year.  For the future he wants to continue working with his same characteristic motivation to be able to expand his business and convert it into a big shoe and clothing store, as he wanted to since he started with the business.

This is his first loan.  He's grateful for the opportunity and is confident about his investment because he thinks it's a great work tool.  He always was a well-known merchant, so his colleagues refer him with regard to making his payments and the good ideas he contributes.

With the 2,000 nuevos soles [PEN] he hopes to stock his business with children's shoes.  He hopes to have a good advantage as a merchant on the end-of-year season.

loans.use: to buy children's shoes

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan Antonio tiene 32 años es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con la cónyuge y los hijos de 5 y 9 años. Vive en  Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

La ventanilla LA VERDAD NOS HARA LIBRES  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito 1, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Juan Antonio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol, además se ddeica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos. Compra y vende sus productos en Ventanas.

El crédito solicita para la compra de semillas, urea, insumos, fertilizantes, ranger, balanceado. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el bienestar de la familia. El sueño  es poder construir la casa  para su familia.

En los tiempos le gusta  jugar indor todos los fines de semana.
texts.en: Juan Antonio, 32, is married and has two children, ages 5 and 9. He lives in Ventanas, Los Rios Province. The communal bank La Verdad Nos Hara Libres (The truth will set us free) is located in the Caimito 1 neighborhood, in the Ventanas canton. The members of this bank work with short-cycle farming of corn and rice. Juan Antonio works in agriculture, planting corn, rice, and beans, in addition to raising chickens and pigs. He buys and sells his products in Ventanas. He is applying for the loan to buy seeds, urea, supplies, fertilizers, herbicide, and animal feed. The loan has helped him to increase his income for the wellbeing of the family. His dream is to build a house for his family. In his free time, he likes to play indoor soccer every weekend.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, supplies, fertilizers, herbicide, and animal feed.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
Mary de 21 años es una joven con muchos deseos de superación, tiene el agrado de formar una pequeña familia junto a Listion y su pequeña Nayeli de 3 añitos, juntos con muchos sueños a futuro residen en la vivienda de sus padres en calidad de alquiler. Al tener el apoyo económico de Listion decidió tan pronto como pudo ser también partícipe del sustento de su economía familiar y cumplir su rol de madre  para con su pequeña iniciando así una pequeña tienda de abarrotes aquel entonces, hoy con 2 años después tiene el orgullo de ser participe del crecimiento económico de su joven familia.
Comenta que optó por el negocio de abarrotes ya que sentía que el campo era una actividad muy complicada para ella y porque deseaba darle toda la atención posible a su pequeña. Gracias a un local que alquila con apoyo de sus padres esta siempre presente en su negocio ganando a su vez muchas amistades que la convierten en una vecina muy conocida en su barrio.
Al hallarse en una buena temporada para todos los comercios de la zona no quiere ser la excepción, es por ello que planea realizar la compra de víveres de primera necesidad así como de panetones de diversas marcas con el fin de realizar una buena campaña por fin de año y a la vez proyectar el abastecimiento de su mercadería con compras al por mayor, generando así ganancias adicionales.
Sus objetivos económicos a largo plazo apuntan a realizar la compra de un lote y la posterior construcción de una vivienda. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles que solicita, espera abastecer su negocio para la campaña de fin de año con víveres al por mayor consistente en arroz, azúcar, conservas y panetones.
texts.en:
Mary, 21, is a young woman who has a strong desire to succeed.  She has formed a small family with Listion and her little, Nayeli, who is 3 years old.  Together they have a lot of dreams for the future.  They live in their parent's home, which is a rental.  Having financial support from Listion, she decided to also participate in supporting the household finances as quickly as she could while also taking care of her child.  To do this, she started up a small grocery store.  Now, two years later, she is proud to be participating in the financial growth of her young family.

She comments that she chose a grocery store business because she felt that farming would be very difficult for her, and because she wanted to provide as much attention as possible to her little one.  Thanks to a store that she rented with the support of her parents she is always in her business and is making a lot of friends.  This has made her very well-known in the neighborhood.

Seeing that this is a good season for all of the merchants in the area, she doesn't want to miss out.  Therefore, she plans to purchase staple consumer products and groceries, such as various brands of panettones (sweet holiday bread), so that she can generate good sales at the end of the year.  She will    also stock up with merchandise purchased at wholesale so that she can generate additional earnings.

Mary's financial goals over the long run are to buy a plot of land and later build a home on it.  With the 3,000 Peruvian soles she requests she hopes to stock up her business for the end-of-year sales, including groceries purchased as wholesale such as rice, sugar, preserves, and panettones.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, preserves, and panettones

loans.name: Zorigt

texts.en:
Zorigt is 54 years old.  He lives with his wife and two children in small house in Niseh District, Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia.  His wife, Enhtsetseg, 36, works part-time at a local cafeteria.  His older son, Telmuun, 16, attends a local secondary school.  Zorigt's younger son, Naranbaatar, 5, attends a local kindergarten. 

Zorigt used to work at a tourist camp as a driver for many years.  He is now planning to start a transportation service business.  In the winter, he would provide transportation within the town.  During the summer, he would take tourists around to see the beautiful nature in Mongolia.  He needs 3,000,000 MNT to purchase a minivan to start his own transportation business.  He is hardworking, positive, and a well-experienced driver.

loans.use: to purchase a minivan to start his own transportation business.

loans.name: Saijrah

texts.en:
Saijrah is forty-four years old.  She lives with her husband and two children in a small house in Niseh District, Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband, Batbold, 48, is in charge of sales for her tailoring business. Her sons, Anhbaatar, 24, and Byambasuren, 21, both work as assistants at local companies.

Saijrah has been operating her tailoring business since 1996.  She has already built close relationships with both local and regional customers and suppliers. She is now requesting a 1,289,800 MNT loan to purchase construction materials to renovate and insulate her workplace in order to increase effectiveness and productivity. She is hardworking, diligent, and an open-minded woman.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to renovate and insulate her workplace in order to increase effectiveness and productivity.

loans.name: Frederick

texts.en:
This is Frederick; he previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for his children's education and in their personal house hold and business expenditures.
He would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan that he will be utilizing to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in his inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and his children's education. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. He has a cellphone loading station now for additional income.
Frederick hopes to give his children a good and quality education and dreams to be successful in business so that he and his family may enjoy the fruit of it. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Divinagracia

texts.en:
Divinagracia, 61, is a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. With help of her children, she is able to manage their household while operating a business. Divinagracia is working hard to continually provide income for her daily expenses.  

Divinagracia operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to cook for one or two people because buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue business operations, she requests a loan of 12,000 PHP. She will utilize the loan to buy additional stocks of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands the business.  

Divinagracia hopes her children will have businesses of their own. She faithfully meets with her fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from her study of the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables and other products

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Don Mario tiene 63 años, viudo y con la satisfacción de haber dado lo mejor de si a sus hijos que son hoy profesionales, forjándose una mejor vida a la que él tuvo de joven.
Con el fruto de su esfuerzo logró culminar la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble donde hoy vive solo. Durante casi 30 años se forjo un camino como comerciante en la venta de ropa y calzados para todas las edades, es cuando al pasar momentos en que la violencia política en nuestro país logra por poco dar un giro en su vida en cuanto a su negocio, pero a pesar de ello siempre tuvo las ganas de trabajar  y salir adelante logrando pasar por alto los inconveniente de aquel entonces y convertir su negocio hasta hoy en un gran sustento para su familia.
Le agrada mucho su trabajo puesto que se siente muy orgulloso de haber logrado hasta hoy y con el apoyo de Dios según comenta la tranquilidad de trabajar y salir adelante.
Dentro de la demanda actual que posee su negocio estás las prendas de vestir para caballeros, complementando su negocio con la venta de mochilas y calzados juveniles, no obstante la época escolar es una gran temporada donde la venta de calzados para los académicos de diversas edades le deja unos buenos ingresos.
Para proyectar su negocio actual desea contar con capital de respaldo con la intención de surtir su negocio con mas prendas de vestir y calzados juveniles. Adicional a ello desea reservar capital para realizar la compra de calzados escolares y aprovechar la demanda que posee dicha temporada. Con los 3,500 nuevos soles que solicita, espera surtir con más mercadería su negocio con la compra de zapatillas y demás calzados juveniles así como reservar capital para la próxima campaña escolar.
texts.en: Mario, 63, is a widow. He has the satisfaction of having given the best of himself to his children, who are professionals today, forging a better life for them than he had when we was young. With the fruit of his effort, he was able to finish building his house from hard-wearing materials, and he lives there alone. For almost 30 years, he worked as a trader, selling clothes and footwear for all ages. There were times when the political violence in the country caused his life and business to take a turn, but despite that, he has always had the desire to work and advance, being able to ignore the problems of those times and turn his business today into a great means to maintain his family. He likes his work a lot because he is very proud of what he has achieved with God's help. He also mentions the peacefulness of working and moving forward. Among the current demand for his business are clothing for men. He complements this business with the sale of backpacks and children's shoes. Nevertheless, school time is when the sale of footwear for students of all ages gives him a good income. To grow his current business, he wants to have capital to stock his business with clothing and children's shoes. He also wants to save capital to buy school shoes and take advantage of that season's demand. With the 3,500 nuevos soles he is applying for, he hopes to stock his business with the purchase of slippers and other children's shoes as well as save money for the next school season.

loans.use: to buy slippers and children's shoes.

loans.name: Maura Yadira

texts.es:
Maura Yadira tiene 33 años  vive en unión libre tiene tres hijos. Vive con el compañero y con los trees hijos Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

La ventanilla  LA VERDAD NOS HARA LIBRES  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito 1, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Maura Yadira se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Compra y vende los productos en Ventanas.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, urea, insumos, ranger, líquido mata plgas. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el bienestar de la familia. El sueño es comprar terrenos para sembrar más maíz.
En los tiempos libres le gusta dormir.
texts.en:
Maura Yadira, 33, lives in a common-law marriage and has three children.  She lives with her partner and three children in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  La Verdad Nos Hará Libres Communal Bank is located in the Caimito 1 area of Ventanas Canton.  This bank works in short-cycle agricultural labor, growing corn and rice.

Maura Yadira makes a living in agriculture growing corn.  She buys and sells her products in Ventanas.

She's requesting the loan to buy seeds, urea, supplies, Ranger [herbicide], and liquid insecticide.  The loan has helped her increase her income for her family's well-being.

Her dream is to buy plots of land to plant more corn.  In her free time she likes to sleep.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, supplies, herbicide, and insecticide

loans.name: Emmanilyn

texts.en: Emmanilyn, 24, is a single entrepreneur in Cabungaan, Clarin with 1 child. She earns money from her transport service business. She has run this business for almost 5 years now and she earns 7,000 PHP a month. To improve business, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP from GDMPC, which she just joined recently, to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, she hopes for the possibility of expanding her business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Tsend-Olzii

texts.en: Tsend-Olzii, 34, lives with her husband in a small house in Niseh district, in Mongolia. Her husband Bayanmunh has worked in private company as a driver for years. The borrower has been running a grocery store. At first, she sold in a local market but she has moved to a spare room in their house on their plot of land. The borrower and her husband purchase inventory from the big market in the city and want to purchase vehicle to reduce their transportation expenses. She is now requesting 6,500,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car for both family and business use. She is a hardworking and diligent person.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly car for both family and business use.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en: Shiela is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 36 years old. Shiela is married and has one child. For a living, Shiela owns and operates a transportation business in the services sector. Shiela has been engaged in this business for 5 years and earns 10,000 PHP per month from her activities. In 2007, Shiela joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 45,000 PHP, which she will use to repair existing vehicles to provide better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicles to provide better service.

loans.name: Rico

texts.en: Rico is a 35-year old resident of Labinay, Ozamis City. He has provided for his 4 children's needs from the little amount of 4,000 PHP he gains monthly from his own piggery business for 6 years. However, this year he became member of GDMPC. He has applied for a loan from GDMPC microfinance of 9,000 PHP to buy feeding supplies. Rico wants to make an expansion to his business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Echo De Miniere Group

texts.fr:
Guillaume est le coordinateur du groupe de Minière Echo. Il est marié et a 2 hijos.El vivent dans la ville de Ouanaminthe en Haïti. Il passa l'entreprise pour les 9 dernières années. Guillaume veut utiliser ce prêt pour acheter du bois pour le mobilier.

Guillaume espérons que ce prêt aidera à développer votre entreprise. D'autres membres de l'Echo de Minière besoin d'un prêt à l'entreprise telles que la vente de tennis, du riz, divers, de la cosmétologie et de poisson.

Guillaume a dit que son principal défi est le manque d'acheteur constante. Il a dit que ses principaux objectifs sont d'accroître l'activité et l'achat de machines pour le travail du bois.
texts.en:
Guillaume is the coordinator of the group Minière Echo. He is married and has two children. He lives in the city of Ouanaminthe, in Haiti. He has been in business for the last nine years. Guillaume wants to use this loan to purchase some wood for furniture. 

Guillaume hopes that this loan will help his enterprise. Other members of Minière Echo have need of a loan for businesses, such as selling athletic shoes, rice, general merchandise, cosmetics, and fish. 

Guillaume said his main challenge is the lack of regular customers. He said his main goals are to grow the business and to buy machines for woodworking.

loans.use: to purchase some wood

loans.name: Paix De Jesus 4, 5 & 6 Group

texts.fr:
Aristilde est le coordinateur de son groupe Paix de Jesus 4, 5 & 6. Il est mariée et il a 2 enfants. Il habite dans la région nord d’Haiti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Aristilde a dirigé son commerce epicerie dont il vend riz, pois et d'autre produits, pendant les 7 dernières années. Il voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir pour renforcer son commerce. Aristilde pense que cet emprunt l’aidera à obtenir un plus grand commerce.

Des autres membres de sont groupe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme le charbon, le produits divers et cosmetologie et des produits alimentaires. Aristilde dit que ses défi principal sont les manques d'achats et trop de personnes lui ont demande le credit et le manque des activites economiques.
texts.en:
Aristilde is the coordinator of his group Paix de Jesus 4, 5 & 6. He is married and has two children. He lives in northern Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. 

For the last seven years, Aristilde has run his grocery business selling rice, peas, and other goods. He would like to use this loan to invest, so as to bolster his business. He thinks that this loan will help him to have a larger business.

Other members of his group have need of a loan for businesses, such as selling charcoal, general merchandise, cosmetics, and grocery items. Aristilde says that his main challenges include the lack of sales, that too many people have asked him for credit, and the lack of economic activity.

loans.use: to purchase rice

loans.name: Equilibre De Ouanaminthe Group

texts.fr:
Mimerose est le coordinatrice de son groupe Equilibre de Ouanaminthe. Elle est marié mais elle a 4 enfants. Elle habite dans la ville de Ouanaminthe d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Mimerose a dirigé son business pendant les 5 dernières années.
