texts.en:
Damaris is a rural resident of Nkubu, and has been active in farming for 18 successive years. She has produced vegetables and milk, going to the local markets and providing for the family needs.

Damaris has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo which she will use to venture into poultry farming. She says this will help her have a more stable farming income, since the poultry business is not adversely affected by weather conditions, as are crops. She hopes to improve her family's living standards with the farming income, and educate her youngest child. She has three children, ages 25, 20, and 18.

She appreciates the Juhudi Kilimo staff for the training in managing a farm as a business. She notes crop failures, pests, and diseases as the major challenges, and the motivation to venture into poultry farming.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds for her new business venture.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a resident of Nkubu with 26 years of experience in mixed farming. She sells the major part of her produce, such as cabbages, tea, maize, and milk, within the local markets. She is a widow with 4 children; the youngest is the only one still in school.

Pamela has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her set a zero-grazing unit (confined area for lifestock, to prevent disease) and buy a chaff cutter (a machine that cuts hay into smaller pieces to be mixed with feed and fed to lifestock).  

She says her improved farming income will enable her to educate her youngest child.  She remains optimistic that she will eventually buy a vehicle to ease transportation of her produce to the market.

Pamela says lack of proper development for the local markets is a major challenge, coupled with pests and diseases.

loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit and buy a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед житель города Истаравшан. Ему 33 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Жена Чамшеда домохозяйка. Чамшед занимается производством и торговлей. Он плетет металлические сетки проволокой. Этим видом деятельности Чамшед занимается 7 лет. Он берет кредит для приобретения дополнительных инструментов и металлической проволоки.
texts.en: Jamshed lives in the city of Istaravshan.  He is 33 years old and is married with four children.  Jamshed's wife is a homemaker.  He works in the production and sale of wire mesh.  He has been in this line of work for seven years.  He is asking for a loan to buy additional tools and metal wire.

loans.use: to buy additional tools and metal wire

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, beans, and other ingredients for the preparation of her waakye for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a resident of Kitale and has been farming for five years within her rural home area. Her main produce has been poultry and horticultural products. She also trades in secondhand clothes to supplement her farming income.

Regina has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. She hopes to raise enough income to provide a better income and education for the children. She is widowed with three children.

She laments poultry diseases and the high cost of poultry feeds as her main challenges.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Mbar

texts.fr: Mbar est un homme marié, père de trois enfants.Il exerce un commerce de produits ménagers depuis près de 4 ans.Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et d'entretenir sa famille.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 150000f pour acheter des sacs de savon en poudre (omo).Il ambitionne d'ouvrir une boutique de vente de produits ménagers.
texts.en:
Mbar is a married father of three children. He has been selling household products for nearly four years, which allows him to support himself and to provide for his family’s needs. 

To strengthen his working capital, he is seeking a loan of 150,000f to buy bags of powder detergent (Omo brand).

His goal is to open a store to sell household products.

loans.use: to buy bags of Omo powder detergent.

loans.name: Aminjon

texts.ru: Аминчон житель района Хамадони. Ему 27 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Аминчон работает таксистом. Он занимается частным извозом. Этим видом деятельности Аминчон занимается два года. Он берет кредит для ремонта своего автомобиля.
texts.en: Aminjon lives in the region of Hamadoni.  He is 27 years old and he is married with two children.  Aminjon works as a private taxi driver.  He has been in this line of work for two years.  He is asking for a loan to make repairs on his car.

loans.use: to buy new auto parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock for her business venture.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is married, and has 3 children. She has received schooling through middle school. 

Aba sells second-hand clothing at Domenase, which she has done for 15 years. Her husband is a mason. Together with her husband, Aba uses her income to support their children. 

Aba will use the loan to purchase more second-hand clothing for resale. With the new profits, Aba plans to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Devaki

texts.en:
Devaki is 40 years old. She is married and has 2 children aged 18 and 15. In 2000, she established her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Devaki plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Enver

texts.en:
Enver, 27, has been working in the kitchen of a restaurant for a very long time. He earns very low salary and now is planning to started his own business in agriculture. He plans to buy a cow in order to sell milk, cheese and other dairy products to earn a living. Enver is married and has two little girls aged three and five years old. 

He is now asking for a loan to buy a cow in order to start a small business in his area. This loan will help him to start his business. He hopes in the future to further expand his business to include a farm and to multiply the number of cows he owns. His goal is to improve the life of his family. He thanks all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Pamfa

texts.en:
Pamfa is 59 years old. She is married and has 2 children, ages 20 and 18.  In 2008, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys grocery goods. 

In the future, Pamfa plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Maiya

texts.en:
Maiya is 41 years old. She is married and has one child, age 16. In 2010, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods.  

In the future, Maiya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Radha

texts.en:
Radha is 28 years old. She is married and has 2 children, ages 9 and 4. In 2010, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods.  

In the future, Radha plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Sima

texts.en:
Sima is 48 years old. She is married and has 4 children, ages 26, 23, 22 and 18. In 2000, she established her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizers.  

In the future, Sima plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.  

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Seoun

texts.en:
Seoun is a 34-year-old villager residing in a rural village in the Tbaung Khmum district in Cambodia’s Kampong Cham province. She is married and blessed with two dependent kids, both of whom are too young for school. 

To earn a living, Seoun works in a rubber field while her husband farms rice to complement the family’s income. Together, this couple generates an income for the family of about 28,000KHR daily and saves about 10,000KHR after paying their daily expenses. 

Seoun has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one loan cycle already, with which she succeeded in meeting the needs of her family. She is now seeking a new loan with VisionFund of 3,000,000KHR to build a proper latrine for her family. Once the latrine is successfully installed, Seoun’s family will be able to live in a better and healthier environment, especially her young kids. Seoun can help to promote sanitation and hygiene practices in her community as well after using this requested loan as she plans.

loans.use: To build a latrine

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Omar

texts.fr: Omar est un homme marié, père de trois enfants.Il exerce le métier de menuisier et vend en meme temps du bois.Cette activité lui permet de générer des revenus assez consistants qui lui assure la prise en charge d'une partie des besoins de sa famille. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 150000f pour acheter du bois de fabrication de meubles.Son ambition est de faire des voyages de commerce dans les pays de la sous région.
texts.en:
Omar is a married father of three children. He is a cabinet-maker who also sells wood, which allows him to earn substantial income that helps him to meet a good portion of his family’s needs. 

To strengthen his working capital, he is seeking a loan of 150,000f to buy wood to make furniture. 

His goal is to make business trips to the sub-regions.

loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a resident of Nkubu and is married with five children, all schooling save for the last born child, age one year. Her farm produce of milk and fruits are sold to the local market.

Catherine has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds for a venture into poultry farming business. She plans to make savings out of the farming income in order to buy more land for expansion of her farming business.

Catherine says occasional climatic changes lead to poor yields, but she remains optimistic she will be able to cater to her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Gun Kehsari

texts.en:
Gun Keshari is 40 years old. She is married and has one child, age 17. In 2010, she established her brass religious statue making business. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid seven loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy raw materials for her business. In the future, Gun Keshari plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts. Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing. In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone. With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume. This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her statue-making business

loans.name: Nanu

texts.en: Nanu is 30 years old. She is married and has one child, age four. In 2002, she established her beauty parlor business.  Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy cosmetics for her business. In the future, Nanu plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic goods for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Darejan

texts.en:
Darejan is 61 years old. She lives in Samtredia District with her daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. Darejan requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Her loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. 

Darejan is involved in a clothing trading business. She requested a loan for further development of it. With the received credit, Darejan will purchase clothes in Turkey at wholesale prices and resell them in her store for a profit. It will be hard work for Darejan, but according to estimations, her business will be profitable and will increase the income of the family. The increased profit will be reinvested in the clothing trading business to increase her stock and sales volume. The family members will be able to earn some savings and buy their own house. Darejan awaits your support.

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Tungatar

texts.en:
Mr. Tungatar is 41 years old and lives with his wife and six children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His wife, Saltanat, is unemployed and helps her husband to run his business of carpentry and plumbing. 

His daughters Erketei and Erkegul are university students, while children Nurbahit, Jansay, Jangul and Nurbol go to local schools. 

Tungatar has been working as plumber and carpenter since 1996. He has already built strong relationships with local customers and suppliers over the years. 

He is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to cover his two oldest daughters' university tuition fees and other school fees. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "I have a lot of responsibility since I have six children, and just the first two go to university, and four more are waiting to be enrolled at university soon."

loans.use: to cover his two oldest daughters' university tuition fees and other school fees.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata est une femme mariée.Elle est mère de deux enfants qui fréquentent l'école.Elle vend du lait caillé dans sa localité.Elle fournit ses clients à domicile. Ce commerce lui rapporte des revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir à certains de ses besoins et de prendre en charge les frais de scolarité de ses filles.Elle sollicite un pret de 100000f pour acheter du lait.Son ambition est de démarrer l'embouche ovine.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is a married mother of two children who attend school. She sells milk curd in her neighbourhood, making home deliveries to her customers. This allows hem to support some of her own needs and to pay for her daughters’ tuition.  

She is seeking a loan of 100,000f to buy milk.

Her goal is to start a sheep fattening activity.

loans.use: to buy milk to make milk curd for sale.

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es:
Mónica tiene 44 años, se describe como una persona jovial, trabajadora y muy positiva en sus objetivos planteados. Mónica es madre soltera tiene una hija de 17 años a la cual ama y quiere darle todo lo que necesita. Mónica trabaja en la realización de productos a base de caucho, negocio que le permite cubrir los gastos de su casa como alimentación, vestimenta y los estudios de su hija. 
Mónica viene trabajando 2 años con Fodemi, el actual crédito que solicita es para para invertir en la compra de llantas de tractor para de ahí sacar el caucho y realizar los diferentes productos que Mónica realiza. Esta inversión ayudará a que Mónica pueda cumplir eficientemente la demanda que tiene en  estos momentos y así obtener buenos ingresos.
Mónica sueña con seguir trabajando en su negocio y seguir ampliándose hacia otros lugares con sus productos y así poder reunir ingresos y poder construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mónica is forty-four years old and is described as a cheerful and hard-working person who is very positive in her posed objectives.  Mónica is a single mother and has one seventeen-year-old daughter.  She loves her daughter and wants to give her everything she needs.  

Mónica works in making rubber products, a business that allows her to cover the home expenses like food, clothing, and her daughter's studies.

Mónica has been working with Fodemi for two years.  The current loan she requests will be used to buy tractor tires; she will then remove the rubber and use it to make different products.  This investment will help Mónica to be able to efficiently meet the demand that she presently has and thereby obtain a good income.  

Mónica dreams of continuing to work in her business and to continue expanding her business to new places with her products.  In doing this, she will be able to combine her incomes and construct her own house.

loans.use: to buy tractor tires in order to then remove the rubber and make different products.

loans.name: Nata

texts.en:
Nata is 22 years old and lives with her child and mother in Kutaisi. Several times, she has requested loans from local financial institutions for her hair care business start-up but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is the small monthly salary earned by Nata’s mother working at a puppet theatre. Nata’s husband works abroad to help financially. 

Nata requested a loan from Credo to start a beauty salon. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions the provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with reasonable conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Nata will purchase equipment for her beauty salon and start a hair care business. She will work as a stylist, and according her estimations, the business will be profitable and will increase the income of the family. The increased profit will be reinvested in the same business. Her family will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to start up a beauty salon

loans.name: Rup Laxmi

texts.en: Rup Laxmi is 42 years old. She is married and has four children. In 2000, she established her tailoring business. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy cloth for her business. In the future, Rup Laxmi plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy cloth for her business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy young buffalo for a livestock business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a buffalo for her husband's livestock business

loans.name: Nilaajav

texts.en:
Mr. Nilaajav is 48 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger (Mongolian housing tent) in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife, Tsendee, age 48, works at a private, small cafeteria as a chef. His son, Narmandah, age 18, and daughter, Battsetseg, age 21, are university students. 

Nilaajav has been a running billiard game center since 2000. He has closed his billiard center because the place he rents has cancelled the contract. He is now planning to start his own business of a taxi service, and he is planning to purchase a car to start the business. 

He is now requesting 1,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase an eco-friendly electric-and-gas consuming car to start his taxi service. He is a hardworking and enthusiastic man.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly electric/gas car to start his taxi service.

loans.name: Ambreen's Group

texts.en:
Ambreen is a 34-year-old woman who lives in Pakistan with her husband and three sons. Her husband owns a small stationery shop, but his income is too low to cover their household expenses. Ambreen herself has been running a small beauty salon at her home for four years.
 
As a member of a four-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase cosmetic products like lipstick, facial creams, etc., as well as chairs for her salon. With the profits, she will first pay back her loan to Kiva, and then she will purchase a variety of cosmetic products for the salon. 

Ambreen's dream is to open a new beauty parlor and to get good profits from that. She wants to thank all the BRAC staff for being so co-operative.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products like lipstick, facial creams, etc.

loans.name: Tayorma Women Group

texts.en:
Finda is 40 years old and married to a diamond miner. The couple has five children -- two in primary school, one in secondary school, and two who are adults. Finda was born in Feama and is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She has been a businesswoman for many years now and works selling food such as rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), margi (to give sauces a sweet taste), flour, sugar, and other products at the market. Despite her financial constraints, Finda has been successful in her business and is able to feed, clothe, and pay school fees for her children.

Finda is requesting a loan to buy the above-mentioned products to add to her stock. Her loan will help her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm-oil, margi, flour, sugar, and other products to sell at the market

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wheat and cotton her husband's business

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana, originaria de León madre de 2 hijos de 3 y 6 años de edad respectivamente, casada , de oficio comerciante , es dueña de una pequeña pulpería ubicada en uno de los  barrios más pobres de la ciudad donde las pulperías no son abundante. Decidió poner este negocio ya que le permite estar cerca de sus hijos y porque la entrada de ingresos es diario, la visita de clientes es muy constante pues siempre busca productos alimenticios para sus hogares. Uno de sus tíos más cercanos a ella la apoyo y motivo desde el principio para que pusiera su propio negocio. De esta manera ella logra conseguir ingresos para mantener a su familia. Está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, aceite, productos de limpieza, avenas, sopas, enlatados, pasta de dientes, papel higiénico etc.  Uno de sus planes futuros es tener un local más grande donde pueda poner una miscelánea bien surtida de productos alimenticios y sus clientes encuentren de todo lo necesario para su hogar.
texts.en: Originally from León, Ana is married and has two children (a three year old and a six year old). She is a shop-keeper, owning a little grocery store in one of the city's poorest areas.  Here there are very few grocery stores.  Ana decided to open the store so she could be close to her children and because it gives her a daily income.  Customers are constantly coming in to buy food for those at home.  One of her closest uncles supports Ana and, right from the beginning, encouraged her to start her own business.  This way, she is able to bring in an income to look after the family. Ana needs financing to buy bulk grains, oil, cleaning products, oats, soups, tinned foods, toothpaste and toilet paper, among other things.  One of her future plans is to have a larger store where she can have a store that is better stocked with food products, where her customers will find everything they need for their homes.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, oil, cleaning products, oats, soups, tinned foods, toothpaste and toilet paper.

loans.name: Iuri

texts.en:
Iuri lives in Vani District, West Georgia, with his retired mother and 18-year-old son. The family is involved in an agricultural business. Iuri owns a vineyard and a plot of land where he grows nuts. The harvested products are sold at the local open market. Besides this, Iuri owns a building-materials workshop and gets monthly income.

Iuri has requested a loan to start his new business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

Iuri will use this loan to purchase wool-processing equipment. He will get orders and renew blankets and mattresses. The family's income will increase, and they will be able to improve their living conditions. Part of the profit will be used for financing the education of Iuri’s son.

loans.use: to purchase wool-processing equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 15 jerrycans of oil, 10 bags of flour, four cases of Fanta, three bags of rice, and more.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Don Manuel un humilde habitante de Granada, es cliente Kiva que esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le ha brindado Kiva y MiCrédito por el préstamo otorgado ya que pudo invertir su primer crédito en su negocio de venta de un plato típico llamado vigoron , el utilizo su primer crédito para comprar paraguas grandes, sillas plásticas y mesas. Ya que este primer crédito le ha sido de mucha ayuda porque le ayudado a mantener a su negocio en buenas condiciones y poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
El esta solicitando su segundo préstamo para comprar sillas, mesas. Ya que el estima que este crédito le ayudaría a cumplir su sueño como es ampliar  el Kiosco y de esta manera mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio con el objetivo de brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y tener un nivel de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Manuel is a humble resident of Granada and a Kiva borrower.  He is really grateful for the support he receives from Kiva and MiCrédito, and for the first loan, which he invested in his business selling Vigoron [yucca and cabbage].  He bought umbrellas, plastic chairs and tables.  That first loan was a big plus because it helped him keep the business in good condition and offer better customer service.

Manuel is seeking a second loan to buy tables and chairs.  He feels the loan will help him realize his dream, which is to expand his kiosk, thus improving infrastructure so he can provide better service to his clientele and have quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: Ousmane est un homme marié, père de deux enfants.Il vend des légumes frais sur une étale au marché de sa localité.Son activité marche assez bien et lui rapporte des revenus qui lui permettent de prendre en charge les frais d'entretien de sa famille ainsi que ses propres besoins.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce; il sollicite un pret de 100000f pour acheter 5 sacs de légumes. Son ambition est de devenir grossiste dans le secteur.
texts.en:
Ousmane is a married father of two children. He has a stall at the local market where he sells fresh vegetables. This activity is fairly successful, allowing him to earn enough to support himself and to take care of his family’s needs. 

To strengthen his working capital, he is seeking a loan of 100,000f to buy five bags of vegetables.  

His goal is to become a local wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy five bags of vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Ndjita

texts.fr: Ndjita est une femme mariée.Elle est mère de trois enfants. Deux de ses enfants fréquentent l'école.Elle mène une activité de couture et a ouvert depuis trois ans un atelier dans sa localité.Cette activité lui permet aujourd'hui de subvenir à ses besoins mais aussi et surtout de prendre en charge les frais d'entretien et de scolarité de ses enfants. Afin d'acheter des tissus, elle sollicite un pret de 200000f.Son ambition est d'améliorer l'équement de son atelier.
texts.en:
Ndjita is a married mother of three children, two of whom attend school. She is a seamstress who opened a sewing shop in her neighborhood three years ago. This allows her to support herself, and more importantly, to provide for her children’s needs and tuition.  

She is seeking a loan of 200,000f to buy fabrics.

Her goal is to upgrade her sewing shop’s equipment.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr: Madame Anta, mariée et mère de famille, est une jeune commerçante qui possède une cantine et vend des tissus, des habits pour enfants, du parfum et de l’encens. Elle a acquis une expérience de deux ans dans ce domaine. Anta est une brave femme qui appuie son mari sur la dépense quotidienne de la famille. Avec le crédit reçu, elle pourra épargner pour améliorer les conditions alimentaires du foyer. Elle désire ouvrir en plus de son activité, une boutique d’alimentation si elle voit son capital augmenter.
texts.en:
Mrs. Anta, married and the mother of a family, is a young shopkeeper who owns a market stall and sells fabric, children's clothing, perfume, and incense. She has acquired two years of experience in this field. Anta is a courageous woman who supports her husband in the family's daily expenses.

With the loan received, she will be able to save in order to improve the household's dietary conditions. In addition to her business, Anta hopes to open a food shop if she sees her capital increase.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and ready-to-wear clothing for children, perfume, and incense.

loans.name: Idalia Isabel

texts.es:
Idalia, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y tiene una hija que estudia secundaria y tambien trabaja con ellos en el negocio de la panadería, que lo tienen en la casa de habitación, trabajan de lunes a sábado.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de pan como la Harina, azúcar, manteca y aceite, esta compra le ayudara a incrementar la producción y fortalecer el inventario, permitiéndole mantener sus ingresos.
La aspiración de Idalia es mejorar el negocio, ofrecerle con ello una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Idalia is 41 years old and married. She and her husband have a daughter who is in secondary school and who also works with them in their bakery business.  The business is at their home and they work from Mondays to Saturdays.

She is requesting a loan to buy the ingredients to make bread, such as flour, sugar, butter and cooking oil. These purchases will help her to increase production and strengthen inventory and therefore enable her to sustain her earnings.

Idalia’s aspiration is to improve the business and to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase floor, sugar, butter and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy grocery items for a grocery-selling business.

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Lili has been engaged in her tailoring activity for the past 10 years. She stitches 'salwar' outfits (traditional Indian dresses) for her customers when they place orders with her. Presently she has one sewing machine with her in her shop. She has a very good relationship with her customers as she completes the orders given to her on time. She provides training to the girls in her village for stitching.

Lili is a 39-year-old widowed lady living with her son and daughter who are in school. After her husband's death she started a tailoring shop in her house to support her family's.
 
She has requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 INR for purchasing two sewing machines and fabrics for her shop; and she also wants to appoint a work force to help her. She says that doing so will increase her capacity for taking orders and increase her customer base. She has a dream to make a big training center for women and provide a good education to her children.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing two sewing machines for her tailoring business

loans.name: Progressive Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the Progressive Group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT and the Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each group member, in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Bondu is the leader of this group. She is 29 years old, married, and has three children – one in primary school and two in secondary school. Bondu sells soft drinks and plastic bottles of water. She has been a businesswoman for ten years. With the help of this loan, she is going to buy crates of soft drinks and bundles of bottled water to add to her current stock. 

Even though Bondu faces a lot of challenges, such as ill health, she has made a huge success of her life. She has been able to buy a plot of land for the future construction of a family dwelling. Her greatest dream is to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cases of soft drinks and bottled water to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Daysi Auxiliadora

texts.es: Daysi de 29 años de edad, habitante de Granada, es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería, padre de 1 hijo el cual esta a su cargo. Daysi es cliente Kiva su primer crédito lo invirtió en la comprar materiales de construcción y construir un pequeño cuarto para  ubicar su pulpería e invertir mas en su negocio. Este primer  crédito le ayudo ya que pudo surtir  su negocio con productos muy solicitados como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, por sus clientes, en el negocio recibe el apoyo de su esposa  que le ayuda con la administración. El ahora requiere de su segundo crédito al igual para invertir en su pulpería con mercadería tales como azúcar, jabón, café, galletas, enlatados, huevo, pan, etc. Todos los productos necesarios para surtir aun más el inventario de su negocio. El estima que este préstamo le será de gran ayuda ya que aumentaran sus ventas generándole más ganancias que  invertirá en su negocio y en la mejora de su vivienda. Sus planes futuros es ampliar más su negocio hasta convertirlo en una miscelánea para tener un negocio estable que le genere  mejores ingresos y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Daysi, 29, lives in Granada and is a merchant. She owns a small grocery store and has one dependent son. Daysi is a Kiva client and used her first loan to buy materials to build a small space for her grocery store and to buy merchandise. This first loan helped her stock her customers' most requested items like rice, sugar, and beans. Her husband helps her manage the business.

She is applying for a second loan to buy all the necessary merchandise to have a larger inventory on hand: sugar, soap, coffee, cookies, canned goods, eggs, bread, and more. She expects that this loan will be of great help in increasing sales and generating profits to reinvest in her business and make improvements to her house. She plans to expand the business in the future and have a bigger store and profitable business that will generate more income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store such as sugar, soap, coffee, cookies, canned goods, eggs, bread, and more.

loans.name: Patricia Esmeralda

texts.es:
Patricia, se le presenta la necesidad de invertir en el negocio, por eso se decide a solicitar un nuevo préstamo,con el que estará comprándose electrodomésticos como una refrigeradora y  mercadería para la tienda como gaseosas, galletas, dulces y otros productos.
Sus condiciones en el negocio se han mantenido estables, el crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar sus ingresos e incrementar sus inventarios, en su familia se mantienen igual el numero de miembros.
texts.en: Patricia, needing to invest in her business, decided to apply for a new loan to buy appliances, like a refrigerator, and merchandise for the store, such as sodas, cookies, candies, and other items. Her business is stable, and her previous loan helped her increase her income and inventory. Her family comprises the same number of people.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, sodas, cookies, and candies.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 54 years old. She lives in the Khobi District with her family: her husband, Simon, and her daughter and son. 

The family takes care of a milk cow owned by the family. The dairy products are mainly consumed by the family and the surplus is sold in the village. Simon works as a plumber and gets a monthly salary. 

Manana requested credit to start up a trade business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative from Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisioning business start-ups and re-startups with credit on soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Manana will purchase a mini-bus to trade mixed products: groceries, dishes, and kitchen appliances. Simon will lead the business. He will purchase various products at wholesale prices and sell them in nearby towns with a price markup. 

The new business initiative will increase the monthly income for the family. Their living conditions will improve and in the future, they will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus for trading.

loans.name: Champa

texts.en:
Champa is a 44-year-old widowed woman. She is a determined individual who works hard to provide her family’s basic needs and her children's education. She lives with her children. She owns a variety store at her house and sells rice, lentils, cooking oil, soap, detergents, toffees, etc., through this shop, earning 4,000 INR per month.

She requested a loan of 30,000 INR to buy more stock of what she sells and some new products like wafers, chocolates, spices, salt, hair oil, etc. She hopes to expand her business to give her family a better quality of life and increase her monthly income.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing rice, lentils, cooking oil, soap, detergents, spices, salt, hair oil, etc., for her variety shop.

loans.name: Satyabhama

texts.en:
Satyabhama is 24 years old, a physically-challenged lady living with her parents and two siblings. She is a hardworking person and has developed a good rapport with her neighbors through her small business. She runs a betel shop where she sells incense sticks, detergents, bathing soaps, tobacco, etc. 

Satyabhama is an active woman. She works hard to provide financial assistance to her father. She needs to refill her stock every three days by travelling to the nearest wholesale market in the village.

Satyabhama requested a loan of 20,000 INR through which she will purchase more supplies and a variety of soap, detergents, hair oil, and toothpaste for her shop. This will help her to reduce her transportation and buying costs, increasing her margin on the merchandise. She aspires to save enough money to make her future secure.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing betel, soap, detergent, tobacco, incense sticks, etc., for her betel shop.

loans.name: Senaval Group

texts.en:
Please meet the members of the Senaval Group from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 2,800,000 for the group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, increase their sales and, consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Kadiatu is the leader of this group. This 42-year-old is married to a contractor, and they have three children. Kadiatu has been a businesswoman for 13 years. She sells clothes, including jeans. She also sells cloth of various kinds.  

Though Kadiatu is financially constrained, she has managed to support her children in their academic pursuits. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy more clothes and fabrics to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and fabrics to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Taliko

texts.en: Taliko is from the Batumi district. She is 44 years old and lives with her son. The only source of income for the family is the small monthly salary earned by Taliko’s son, working as a hotel administrator. As the existing income is not enough for the family, Taliko has decided to start a new business. She plans to finish renovating a family-owned store and to rent it out for a good price. Taliko has applied for loans from local financial institutions several times, for a business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of her lack of experience in the new business, as the local credit providers usually require experience. However, her loan request has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up and re-start loans on  soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, since they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income levels. With this loan, Taliko will repair her store and renovate it properly so that it satisfies the needs of her clients. Taliko hopes her business will be profitable and that this will increase her income and provide her family with enough money to satisfy their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate a store to rent out.

loans.name: Latif

texts.en:
Latif lives in the Baku region with his family. Latif has been in this grocery business for eight years. Now he needs 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manats) to buy more products for his business for the new year. Latif is 42 years old. He is married and has three children. 

It is the second loan for Latif. He was very thankful to Kiva and the lenders for helping him in his business.

loans.use: to buy products for his shop.

loans.name: Jamada

texts.en:
Jamada's love for goats was undoubted since childhood. He was devoted to caring for them until he later started rearing them for sale after dropping out of elementary school.

He sells the goats mainly to the butchery, who slaughters them for meat. He has a large market because his goats are not very expensive since he grazes them on his own farm. He plans to change his piece of land so that the goats will be able to graze by themselves, saving him the cost of a laborer. With the business, he is able to feed his wife and three children and give them the basic necessities plus tuition. He is a very hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy baby goats.

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en: Jovia is forever grateful for the lenders that contributed to funding her previous loan, which enabled her to acquire a piece of land. With the piece of land, she was able to increase her farming and even bought some cows, which are grazing on the land. This has increased her output, providing her with more income so she can now ably meet her household needs. She will also be able to raise the money to pay for the tuition for her son who is enrolling in a university next year. Jovia is a committed and honest woman.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Dominga Andrea

texts.es: Dominga, de 56  años de edad, originario de  Granada, soltera, madre  de 3 hijos, es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de rosquilla, confites y periódicos desde hace 2 años, su primer crédito fue de gran ayuda ya que le permitió invertir en el inventario de su negocio, incrementaron sus ventas que le genera la vez mas ingresos. Su primer préstamo lo utilizo para compra de golosina y rosquilla somoteña, pues su producto tiene mucha demanda. Ella  desea hacer crecer en su negocio con productos de alta calidad es por eso que hoy en día solicita un segundo  préstamo  para invertir aun mas en su negocio en la compra de rosquilla.  Con el objetivo de cubrir la demanda de los clientes, el estima que esta nueva inversión será de ayuda ya que podrá mantener su negocio activo, ella espera contar con el apoyo de Kiva para seguir  trabajando en su negocio,  obtener mas ingresos y poder ofrecerle un mejor nivel económico a su familia.
texts.en: Dominga is 56 years old and from Granada.  She’s the single mother of three children and sells donuts, candy, and newspapers and has done so for two years.  Her first loan was a great help and allowed her to invest in inventory for her business.  Her sales increased and so did her income.  She used the money to buy snacks and donuts because these are in great demand.  She wants to grow her business with high quality products so she is asking for her second loan to invest in her business and buy more donuts.  Her goal is to meet her customer’s needs and estimates that this loan will help keep the business active.  She is hoping for Kiva’s support and to increase her income so she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy donuts.

loans.name: Joy Group

texts.en:
Sitta is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Sowa 35 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has two children, one of whom is attending primary school. For many years now, Sitta has been selling market food – palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), Maggi (use to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, onions, rice, etc. 

Sitta and her group members have applied for a loan of 3,200,000 Leones from SMT/Kiva lenders. This loan will empower them financially, enabling them to buy more inventories to add to their respective businesses. 

Though Sitta faces some financial challenges that have hindered her business from developing to the level she wants it to, she has been able to make a lot of achievement from her business. One of Sitta’s greatest success stories is that of feeding her children and educating her child. 

This loan will go a long way in mitigating Sitta's financial difficulties. She is going to use it to buy more palm oil, Maggi, pepper, onions, rice, etc. to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, Maggi, pepper, onions, rice, etc. to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Sose

texts.en:
Sose is fifty-one years old and a Roma mother of one grown-up child, living a major city of south-central Albania. 

She sells used items, particularly clothes, and has been practicing this activity for the last seven years. “The profit has been good,” Sose claims, “and despite the fact that I have been the only financial provider for my family, still the earnings I have gained have given me more than the basics,” she continues.

Sose is in need now of a loan of approximately $ 950 to buy more used items to resell. This would be her first loan from this institution.

loans.use: To buy used clothes to resell

loans.name: Bassama Group

texts.en:
Issata is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Gbense, in eastern Sierra Leone. Issata is married to an okada driver (motor bike taxi driver), and they have three children, one of whom is attending primary school. Issata sells dried fish of different types. She has been running this business for many years.  

Issata faces a number of challenges in her business but, notwithstanding that, she has also had some great successes. She has been able to purchase a piece of land for the future construction of a family dwelling. Her greatest dream is to gain more financial support in order to further expand her business. 

This Kiva loan will help mitigate her financial difficulties. She is going to use it to buy baskets of dried fish to add to her current stock. 

(Also included in the photo is loan officer Edmond, in the white shirt, posing with his clients.)

loans.use: to buy baskets of dried fish to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey lives in an area where keeping cattle is the predominant economic activity. Now 28, he learned the activity while still living with his father, who was in the same business. He already owns some cows that he is feeding on improved feeds to fatten them. When they gain more weight, he will sell them at a higher price. His dream has always been of being rich, which is the reason he is getting loans when he is young and working hard. He hopes that, by the time he is 50, he will no longer have to struggle, because he will have accumulated enough assets to bring in income. He is a hard-working and committed young man.

loans.use: to buy cows to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en:
Amiran is 44 years old. He lives in Khelvachauri District with his family: his wife, his 10-year-old daughter and his retired mother. Amiran takes care of a milk cow owned by the family. The dairy products are mainly consumed by the family and the surplus is sold in the village. Besides this, he grows mandarins and sells them at the local open market. 

According to government estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category, and they get monthly social assistance. 

Amiran requested credit to start up a trade business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative from Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisioning business start-ups and re-startups with credit on soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Amiran will purchase a mini-bus to trade fruits and vegetables. He will buy products in East Georgia at wholesale prices and sell them at a good price in his district. The new business initiative will increase the monthly income for the family. Their living conditions will improve, and in the future, they will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus for trading fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders who lended two loans to her previously when she needed money most. Because of her grocery store business, Fatuma has been able to help support her husband in paying for their first marital home to be built. However, it is still incomplete. Therefore Fatuma is requesting this particular loan to pay for more materials such as cement and shutters so they can finish building their home. She will also use a small part to buy some stock for her grocery store. She is a very hardworking and resilient woman.

loans.use: To buy materials to finish building her house.

loans.name: Xelvin Herson Josue

texts.es:
Xelvin, se le presento la oportunidad de seguir invirtiendo en el negocio, por eso solicita un préstamo para la compra de madera, pintura, barniz, una cierra, con esto lograra que la carpintería tenga los materiales para elaborar muebles.

El crédito anterior le ayudo a fortalecer mas el negocio, con lo más necesario para la elaboración de muebles, sus condiciones económicas han estado mejorando, en su familia todos se encuentran bien, la carpintería ha funcionado correctamente.
texts.en:
Xelvin had the opportunity to continue investing in his business, so he's requesting a loan to buy wood, paint, varnish, and a saw so he has the materials to make furniture in his carpentry shop.

The previous loan helped him strengthen his business more with what he most needed to make furniture.  His financial situation has been improving.  Everyone in his family is well and his shop has run appropriately.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint, varnish, and a saw

loans.name: Kujtim

texts.en:
Kujtim, who is a Roma man, lives in a major city of south central Albania. He is married and has an only child. He is requesting a first loan from VisionFund Albania to buy an inventory of second-hand clothing to resell.
 
Buying and selling such items have been Kujtim’s activity for the past fifteen years. “It is one of the activities that Roma people enjoy and are good at doing it,” he said. “Sometimes we buy used clothes and resell them, but sometimes we get them for free from the churches in Greece, and the years prior to the failure in that country’s economy were considered golden for us. We made very good profit, even though we sold for cheap,” he continued saying.

In addition to this activity, Kujtim works in construction as well, a profession that he learned while immigrating to Greece.

loans.use: to buy inventories of second-hand clothes to resell.

loans.name: Shamil

texts.en:
This is the second loan for Shamil. He was very thankful to Kiva and lenders for helping him.

Now he needs 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manats) to buy more cows for improving his business for the new year. 

Shamil is 24 years old. He is married and has a daughter. He lives in the Absheron region with his family. Shamil sells milk, cheese, and yogurt to shops. He has been in this agriculture business for three years.

loans.use: to buy more cows.

loans.name: Shushanta Ku

texts.en:
Shushanta ku is a 24-year-old differently-abled person living with his parents, wife and a son in Odisha, India.

Shushanta ku is a very hardworking and responsible man. He has taken on all the burdens and responsibilities of his family. He is engaged in the activity of making paper plates and paper bowls, which he sells in the market in his village or supplies directly to the dealers of paper products.

He has a plan to expand his business by purchasing a new and automatic machine for making paper products, so that he can increase his production. He has requested a loan of 25,000 Indian Rupees (INR).

He wants to increase his monthly income and save some money for his child's future.

loans.use: to buy a new automated machine for making paper bowls and plates.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is married with four children and lives in the outskirts of Lyantonde town. Six years ago, she started selling imported used clothing so that she could earn some income to meet her family needs. Her major challenge has been limited capital and stiff competition from fellow traders. 

She hopes with the loan, she will be able to buy better quality clothes, which will bring her more customers, enabling her to beat the competition. She is optimistic the partnership will bring her closer to her dreams.

loans.use: To buy clothes for selling.

loans.name: Zibulatudde Development Grp Group

texts.en:
Musa is a 39-year-old man who deals in agriculture, specifically tomato growing, in Butende village. He began this business because he wanted to raise money to cater for his family's needs and pay school fees for his children. He has 11 children, and eight of them are school-going. 

His main challenges include price fluctuations and transport hardships from the village to other market areas like Kampala. He would like to expand his  business to get more income to support his children and meet their school-fee requirements. He is grateful to the group because through it, he has received connections and a market. He is very hardworking and encourages youth not to overlook farming, because even through it, one can get rich.

loans.use: To buy improved tomato seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José, tiene una granja de pollos de engorde, tiene 39 años de edad, está casado y tiene dos hijos, José administra una granja de pollos la cual tiene en su casa, trabaja todos los días, su esposa se encarga de vender los pollos ya alineados, por libras.
Actualmente José solicita un préstamo para la compra de concentrado y tambien pollos para aumentar la granja, esto le ayudara para crecer en el negocio y contar con la alimentación necesaria para ellos, este crecimiento le permitirá generar más ingresos.
La aspiración de José es tener más amplia la granja, ayudándole a mejorar su condición en la familia y la vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is thirty-nine, married with two children, and has a chicken farm at his house.  He works every day. He wife takes care of selling the fattened-up chickens by the pound.  

José is currently seeking a loan to buy feed concentrate and chickens so he can expand his farm.  This will help him get the feed the chickens need, and expand the business so he can generate more income.

José's aspiration is to expand the farm so he can improve his children's lives and conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed concentrate and chickens for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy dozens of plastic shoes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Reinelda

texts.es: Doña Reinelda, tiene 52 años de edad, casada, su esposo trabaja con un taxi, tiene 3 hijos y vive con ellos en el municipio de Intibucá. A ella siempre le ha gustado la confección de ropa, lleva 15 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de cojines de diferentes diseños y también hace reparaciones de prendas de vestir. Los cojines los vende en el mercado local y a personas particulares. Esta actividad le ha ayudado a generar ingresos para cubrir gastos del hogar. El préstamo que solicita es por 7,000 Lempiras y es el cuarto prestamo obtenido con ODEF, el cual lo va utilizar para comprar más telas e hilos que necesita para seguir confeccionando cojines. Este préstamo le ayudara a mantener materia prima para trabajar solvente. Su meta es mantener siempre el negocio para ayudar al hogar y a sus hijas con el estudio.
texts.en:
Reinelda is 52 years old, and she is married.  Her husband works with a taxi.  She has three children, and she lives with them in the Intibucá municipality.  She has always liked making clothes.  

She has been making different designs of cushions for 15 years.  She also mends clothes.  She sells the cushions at the local market and to the general public.  This business activity has helped her generate income to cover household expenses.

She is requesting a loan for 7,000 lempiras.  This is her fourth loan with ODEF, and she will use it to buy more fabric and thread that she needs to keep making cushions.  This loan will help her to keep raw materials on hand in order to work and be solvent.

Her goal is to always keep her business in order to help her household and her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and thread to make cushions to sell.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es:
Olga, tiene 38 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de santa Cruz de Yojoa, junto a su esposo e hijos.
Ella tiene su propio cultivo de café desde hace 15 años. Produce café en pergamino y lo vende en el mercado de la zona. Ella lleva cuatro ciclos de préstamos en ODEF, el préstamo actual es por 5,000 Lempiras el cual lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y abonos para la siembra y darle mantenimiento a la finca de café. Su objetivo es mejorar mas la producción e incrementar sus ingresos para poderles dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Olga, 38, has 2 children.  She lives with her husband and children in a village in the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa. 

Olga has had her own coffee farm for 15 years.  She produces parchment coffee (dried, but un-hulled coffee beans) that she sells in a market in the area. Olga has gone through 4 loan cycles with ODEF.  This loan is for 5,000 Honduran lempiras, and she plans to invest it in the purchase of chemical and organic fertilizers so that she can maintain her coffee crops.  Her goal is to increase her production and also her income, so that she can give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chemical and organic fertilizers for her coffee crops

loans.name: L'amitie De Ouanaminthe Group

texts.fr:
Molene est le coordinatrice de son groupe L'Amitie de Ouanaminthe. Elle est marié mais elle a 4 enfants. Elle habite dans la ville de Ouanaminthe d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Molene a dirigé son business pendant les 3 dernières années. 

Molene voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat des produits différents, des chaussettes, des vêtements, cosmétiques, etc. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Des autres membres de L'Amitie de Ouanaminthe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du Cosmetiques, chaussures,charbon, du riz et du poisson. Molene dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant.
texts.en:
Molene is the coordinator of her group L'Amitie de Ouanaminthe. She is married and has four children. She lives in the city of Ouanaminthe, Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. Molene has been managing her business for the last three years.

Molene would like to use this loan to invest by purchasing different products, shoes, clothing, cosmetics, etc. She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business. Other members of the group L'Amitie de Ouanaminthe have need of a loan for such businesses as selling cosmetics, shoes, charcoal, rice, and fish. Molene says that her main challenge is the lack of steady customers.

loans.use: to purchase different products, shoes, clothing, cosmetics, etc. to sell

loans.name: Goodness Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the Goodness Group from Koidu, in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 each (SLL 4,000,000 in total). With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Yei is the featured leader of this group. The 55-year-old is married to a motor mechanic and they have three children attending primary school. 

Yei has been a businesswoman for 20 years. She sells palm oil (the country’s favorite cooking oil), margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, fish, flour, sugar, etc. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy wholesale, the aforementioned items to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy wholesale, palm-oil, margi, salt, fish, flour, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Les Refferances De Bordemer 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Josue est le coordinateur de son groupe Les Refferences de Bordemer 1, 2 & 3. Il est mariée et il a 3 enfants. Il habite dans la région du Bordemer d’Haiti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Josue a dirigé son commerce du Ventes Diverses, pois et d'autre produits, pendant les 7 dernières années. Il voudrait utiliser cet emprunt d'investir dans d'achat les produits cosmétiques, chaussures et autres produits. 

Josue pense que cet emprunt l’aidera à obtenir un plus grand commerce. Des autres membres de sont groupe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme le charbon, le produits divers et cosmetologie et des produits alimentaires. Josue dit que son principal défi est le manque d'acheteurs, de sorte que votre entreprise reste faible. Son rêve principal est de faire croître votre entreprise.
texts.en:
Josue is the coordinator of his group Refferences de Bordemer 1, 2 & 3. He is married and has three children. He lives in the Bordemer region of Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. Josue has been managing his business selling a variety of goods, peas, and other products for the last seven years. He would like to use this loan to invest by purchasing cosmetic products, shoes, and other products.

Josue thinks that this loan will help him to have a larger business. Other members of the group have need of a loan for such businesses as selling charcoal, general goods, cosmetics, and grocery items. Josue says that his main challenge is the lack of steady customers, to the extent that the enterprise remains weak. His main dream is to grow his enterprise.

loans.use: to invest in selling various goods

loans.name: Les Prodiges De Dilaire Group

texts.fr:
Erold est le coordinateur du groupe de Les Prodiges de Dilaire. Il est célibataire et n'a pas d'enfant. Il vivent dans la ville de Ouanaminthe en Haïti. Il passa l'entreprise pour les 4 dernières années. Erold veut utiliser ce prêt pour acheter du tennis et autres chaussures. 

Erold espérons que ce prêt aidera à développer votre entreprise. D'autres membres deLes Prodiges de Dilaire besoin d'un prêt à l'entreprise telles que la vente de tennis, du riz, divers, de la cosmétologie et de poisson. Erold dit que son principal défi est le manque d'acheteur constante. Il a dit que son principal objectif est de vendre plus et acheter un véhicule pour sortir et vendre.
texts.en:
Erold is the coordinator of the group Les Prodiges de Dilaire. He is unmarried and has no children. He lives in the city of Ouanaminthe, in Haiti. He has been managing his enterprise for the last four years. Erold wants to use this loan to purchase athletic shoes and other footwear. 

Erold hopes that this loan will help him to develop his enterprise. Other members of Les Prodiges de Dilaire have need of a loan for such enterprises as selling athletic shoes, rice, general merchandise, cosmetics, and fish. Erold said his main challenge is the lack of steady customers. He said his main goal is to sell more and to purchase a vehicle for getting out and making sales.

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Terla Vadeza

texts.es: Terla tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo, es una mujer amable y muy dedicada a su trabajo, el único inconveniente que enfrenta es la salud de su hijo que tuvo problemas al nacer y lo tiene que tener en constante tratamiento. Terla se dedica a  la venta de abarrotería y papelería, también vende zapatos, botas y sandalias. Ella inicio comprando unos cerdos con un dinero que le regalaron y luego con la ganancia empezó a comprar sandalias y zapatos de diferentes estilos, el negocio lo comenzó desde hace 10 años y todavía se dedica al mismo rubro, el horario de trabajo es de 5:00 am  a 5:00 pm, la única desventaja es el tiempo que invierte en el negocio ya que casi no puede dedicarle tiempo a su hijo. El préstamo que Terla solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería como ser: sandalias, zapatos para hombres y lociones. Con la ayuda de este préstamo podrá surtir el negocio  y esto le ayudara a incrementar más sus ventas y obtener más ganancias con lo que podra comprarle los medicamentos a su hijo. La meta de Terla es tener mejor acondicionado su negocio y agrandar el local. Es el segundo crédito que solicita en FAMA y ha cacelado sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en: Terla is 32 years old, a single mother of one son, and is a kind woman who is very dedicated to her work.  The only obstacle she faces is the health of her son who had complications at birth and needs to have constant treatments.  Terla works selling groceries and stationery.  She also sells shoes, boots, and sandals.  She began buying pigs with some money she was given, and using the earnings, started buying sandals and shoes of different styles.  The business began ten years ago and she still dedicates herself to the same work.  The work schedule is from 5:00 am to 5:00 pm.  The only disadvantage is the time that she invests in the business is time she cannot devote to her son.  The loan that Terla seeks is needed to invest in merchandise like: sandals, and shoes for men and lotions.  With the help of this loan she will be able to stock her business and this will help her to increase her sales and earn more in order to buy medicine for her son.  Terla's goal is to improve the condition of her business and enlarge the store.  This is her second line of credit with FAMA and has always made her payments on time.

loans.use: COMPRA DE SANDALIAS, ZAPATOS PARA HOMBRE Y LOCIONES

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rabbits, chickens and feed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo es una persona que se describe como una persona alegre, positivo y muy trabajador. Rodrigo vive con su hermana y su madre no tiene hijos, pero ama a su familia y quiere darles todo lo que ellos necesitan para sobrevivir. Rodrigo trabaja en la realización de productos a base de caucho, negocio que le permite cubrir los gastos de su casa  y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Rodrigo viene trabajando con FODEMI desde hace 2 años atrás y tiene 3 créditos a su haber,  el actual crédito que solicita es para para invertir en la compra de 90 llantas ring 12 para de ahí sacar el caucho que es la materia prima para realizar los diferentes productos que vende en el mercado. Esta inversión ayudará a que Rodrigo pueda cumplir la demanda que tiene en  estos momentos y así obtener buenos ingresos.
Rodrigo sueña con seguir trabajando en su negocio y seguir ampliándose hacia otros lugares con sus productos y seguir ayudando en su casa, dándoles todo lo que necesiten.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is a person who is described as being cheerful, positive and very hard-working. Rodrigo lives with his mother and his sister. He does not have children, but he loves his family and wants to give them everything they need to survive. Rodrigo works making products made out of rubber, a business which allows him to cover his household expenses and improve his family's quality of life. 

Rodrigo has been working with FODEMI for 2 years and has 3 loans to his name. The current loan he is requesting is to invest in buying 90 size 12 tires so that he can remove the rubber, which is the raw material for making the various products he sells at the market. This investment will help Rodrigo cover the demand he has during these times and thus obtain a good income. 

Rodrigo's dream is to keep working on his business and continue to expand into other places with his products, and to keep helping in his household, giving his family everything they need.

loans.use: to buy tires to remove the rubber and create the various products he sells.

loans.name: Claudia Elena

texts.es:
Claudia, quiere seguir trabajando en el negocio, por eso solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de maíz, plancha para hacer las tortillas, tambien comprara verdura frescas para vender, tomates, plátanos, cebollas, entre otra mercadería que le sirvan para crear ingresos.

Con el préstamo anterior Claudia tuvo un efecto positivo, porque creció el inventario del negocio, atendió bien a los clientes, en su familia considera que ha estado todo bien, uno de sus hijo en este año se gradúa de noveno grado.
texts.en:
Claudia wants to continue working in her business. That is why she is applying for a new loan to buy corn, and a grill for making tortillas. She will also buy fresh vegetables to sell, such as tomatoes, plantains and onions, as well as other merchandise that help her generate income. 

With the previous loan, Claudia saw a positive effect, because she increased her business's inventory and served her clients well. She feels that  everything has been well with her family; one of her children graduated from ninth grade this year.

loans.use: To buy corn, a grill, tomatoes, plantains and onions.

loans.name: Flamme De Dilaire Group

texts.fr:
Fortune est le coordinatrice de son groupe Flamme de Dilaire. Elle est marié mais elle a 3 enfants. Elle habite dans la ville de Dilaire d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Fortune a dirigé son business pendant les 4 dernières années.

Fortune voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat des produits différents, des chaussettes, des vêtements, cosmétiques, etc. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Des autres membres de Flamme ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du Cosmetiques, chaussures,charbon, du riz et du vetement. Fortune dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant.
texts.en:
Fortune is the coordinator of her group Flamme de Dilaire. She is married and has three children. She lives in the city of Dilaire, Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. Fortune has been managing her business for the last four years. 

Fortune would like to use this loan to invest in  purchasing a variety of goods, socks, clothing, cosmetics, etc.  She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business. Other members of Flamme have need of a loan for such businesses as selling cosmetics, shoes, charcoal, ice, and clothing. Fortune says her main challenge is the lack of steady customers.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods to sell

loans.name: Rosa Albertina

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa tiene 64 años de edad,  es madre soltera, tiene una hija, reside en una comunidad del Municipio de Puerto Cortes, Departamento de Cortés.
Doña Rosa se ha dedicado toda su vida a oficios domésticos y a la venta de tortillas de maíz, además ofrece el servicio de molienda de maíz con un molino eléctrico.
Con la ayuda de su única hija trabajan atendiendo los clientes que demanda sus tortillas y también dedican tiempo para  atender la clientela que demandan el servicio de molienda de  maíz.
Actualmente solicito un préstamo por la cantidad de 6,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de tortillas (maíz y leña) y mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio.
Manifiesta que decidió dedicarse a esta actividad por la necesidad de generar ingresos que le permitan su manutención.
Tiene como meta adquirir otro molino para lograr una ampliación de su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 64 years old and a single mother with one daughter. She lives in the community of Puerto Cortes in Cortes department. Rosa has devoted her whole life to household tasks and to selling corn tortillas. In addition, she offers a service grinding corn with her electric mill. 

With the help of her only daughter, she works serving customers who ask for her tortillas, and also devotes time to serving customers that ask for corn-milling services.

Now she has applied for a loan in the amount of 6,000 lempiras, which she intends to use to buy materials for making tortillas (corn and firewood), and to improve her business's infrastructure.

She says that she decided to do this work because she needed to generate income to support herself. Her goal is to acquire another mill so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy corn and firewood for making tortillas, and improve her business's infrastructure.

loans.name: Ramon Aquilino

texts.es:
Ramón, tiene la necesidad de invertir en la siembra de maíz por regadillo, comprado de los fondos prestados el abono y la semilla, los cuales utilizara para iniciar la siembra.
Él considera que a través de estos préstamos ha logrado realizar su trabajo en la siembra, mejorando las cosechas, vendiendo parte de ellas para generar ingresos a la familia, en este periodo ha mantenido la calidad de vida en su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Ramón needs to invest in the sowing of corn. With the loan funds he purchased fertilizers and seeds, which he will use to start the sowing.
